"$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-00:00-Oscar Wilde": {
    "title": "$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-00:00-Oscar Wilde",
    "time": "00:00",
    "quote_first": "As ",
    "quote_time_case": "midnight",
    "quote_last": " was striking bronze blows upon the dusky air, Dorian Gray, dressed commonly, and with a muffler wrapped round his throat, crept quietly out of his house.",
    "quoteSourceTitle": "The Picture of Dorian Gray",
    "quoteAuthor": "Oscar Wilde",
    "sfw": "yes"
},

"$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-00:00-James Joyce": {
    "title": "$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-00:00-James Joyce",
    "time": "00:00",
    "quote_first": "“But wait till I tell you,” he said. “We had a ",
    "quote_time_case": "midnight",
    "quote_last": " lunch too after all the jollification and when we sallied forth it was blue o'clock the morning after the night before”",
    "quoteSourceTitle": "Ulysses",
    "quoteAuthor": "James Joyce",
    "sfw": "yes"
},

"$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-00:00-Vladimir Nabokov": {
    "title": "$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-00:00-Vladimir Nabokov",
    "time": "00:00",
    "quote_first": "“",
    "quote_time_case": "Midnight",
    "quote_last": ",” you said. What is midnight to the young? And suddenly a festive blaze was flung Across five cedar trunks, snow patches showed, And a patrol car on our bumpy road Came to a crunching stop. Retake, retake!",
    "quoteSourceTitle": "Pale Fire",
    "quoteAuthor": "Vladimir Nabokov",
    "sfw": "yes"
},

"$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-00:00-Ike Oguine": {
    "title": "$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-00:00-Ike Oguine",
    "time": "00:00",
    "quote_first": "That a man who could hardly see anything more than two feet away from him could be employed as a security guard suggested to me that our job was not to secure anything but to report for work every night, fill the bulky ledger with cryptic remarks like ‘Patrolled perimeter ",
    "quote_time_case": "12.00 pm",
    "quote_last": ", No Incident’ and go to the office every fortnight for our wages and listen to the talkative Ms Elgassier.",
    "quoteSourceTitle": "A Squatter's Tale",
    "quoteAuthor": "Ike Oguine",
    "sfw": "yes"
},

"$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-00:00-John Donne": {
    "title": "$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-00:00-John Donne",
    "time": "00:00",
    "quote_first": "‘Tis the year’s ",
    "quote_time_case": "midnight",
    "quote_last": ", and it is the day’s, Lucy’s, who scarce seven hours herself unmasks; The sun is spent, and now his flasks Send forth light squibs, no constant rays;",
    "quoteSourceTitle": "A Nocturnal upon St Lucy's Day",
    "quoteAuthor": "John Donne",
    "sfw": "yes"
},

"$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-00:00-Yasunari Kawabata": {
    "title": "$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-00:00-Yasunari Kawabata",
    "time": "00:00",
    "quote_first": "At ",
    "quote_time_case": "midnight",
    "quote_last": " his wife and daughter might still be bustling about, preparing holiday delicacies in the kitchen, straightening up the house, or perhaps getting their kimonos ready or arranging flowers. Oki would sit in the living room and listen to the radio. As the bells rang he would look back at the departing year. He always found it a moving experience.",
    "quoteSourceTitle": "Beauty and Sadness",
    "quoteAuthor": "Yasunari Kawabata",
    "sfw": "yes"
},

"$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-00:00-Shakespeare": {
    "title": "$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-00:00-Shakespeare",
    "time": "00:00",
    "quote_first": "Bernardo: ‘Tis now struck ",
    "quote_time_case": "twelve",
    "quote_last": "; get thee to bed, Francisco.",
    "quoteSourceTitle": "Hamlet",
    "quoteAuthor": "Shakespeare",
    "sfw": "yes"
},

"$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-00:00-Angela Carter": {
    "title": "$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-00:00-Angela Carter",
    "time": "00:00",
    "quote_first": "Big Ben concluded the run-up, struck and went on striking. (…) But, odder still - Big Ben had once again struck ",
    "quote_time_case": "midnight",
    "quote_last": ". The time outside still corresponded to that registered by the stopped gilt clock, inside. Inside and outside matched exactly, but both were badly wrong. H’m.",
    "quoteSourceTitle": "Nights At The Circus",
    "quoteAuthor": "Angela Carter",
    "sfw": "yes"
},

"$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-00:00-Samuel Beckett": {
    "title": "$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-00:00-Samuel Beckett",
    "time": "00:00",
    "quote_first": "It is ",
    "quote_time_case": "midnight",
    "quote_last": ". The rain is beating on the windows. I am calm. All is sleeping. Nevertheless I get up and go to my desk. I can’t sleep. …",
    "quoteSourceTitle": "Molloy",
    "quoteAuthor": "Samuel Beckett",
    "sfw": "yes"
},

"$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-00:00-David Foster Wallace": {
    "title": "$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-00:00-David Foster Wallace",
    "time": "00:00",
    "quote_first": "Gately can hear the horns and raised voices and u-turn squeals way down below on Wash. That indicate it’s around ",
    "quote_time_case": "0000h",
    "quote_last": "., the switching hour.",
    "quoteSourceTitle": "Infinite Jest",
    "quoteAuthor": "David Foster Wallace",
    "sfw": "yes"
},

"$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-00:00-William Shakespeare": {
    "title": "$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-00:00-William Shakespeare",
    "time": "00:00",
    "quote_first": "We have heard the chimes at ",
    "quote_time_case": "midnight",
    "quote_last": ".",
    "quoteSourceTitle": "Henry IV",
    "quoteAuthor": "William Shakespeare",
    "sfw": "yes"
},

"$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-00:00-Marcel Proust": {
    "title": "$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-00:00-Marcel Proust",
    "time": "00:00",
    "quote_first": "He is certain he heard footsteps: they come nearer, and then die away. The ray of light beneath his door is extinguished. It is ",
    "quote_time_case": "midnight",
    "quote_last": "; some one has turned out the gas; the last servant has gone to bed, and he must lie all night in agony with no one to bring him any help.",
    "quoteSourceTitle": "Swann's Way",
    "quoteAuthor": "Marcel Proust",
    "sfw": "yes"
},

"$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-00:00-Kate Atkinson": {
    "title": "$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-00:00-Kate Atkinson",
    "time": "00:00",
    "quote_first": "I am conceived to the chimes of ",
    "quote_time_case": "midnight",
    "quote_last": " on the clock on the mantelpiece in the room across the hall. The clock once belonged to my great-grandmother (a woman called Alice) and its tired chime counts me into the world.",
    "quoteSourceTitle": "Behind the Scenes at the Museum",
    "quoteAuthor": "Kate Atkinson",
    "sfw": "yes"
},

"$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-00:00-Emily Bront\u00EB": {
    "title": "$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-00:00-Emily Brontë",
    "time": "00:00",
    "quote_first": "I took her hand in mine, and bid her be composed; for a succession of shudders convulsed her frame, and she would keep straining her gaze towards the glass. ‘There’s nobody here!’ I insisted. ‘It was YOURSELF, Mrs. Linton: you knew it a while since.’ ‘Myself!’ she gasped, ‘and the clock is striking ",
    "quote_time_case": "twelve",
    "quote_last": "! It’s true, then! that’s dreadful!'",
    "quoteSourceTitle": "Wuthering Heights",
    "quoteAuthor": "Emily Brontë",
    "sfw": "yes"
},

"$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-00:00-Salman Rushdie": {
    "title": "$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-00:00-Salman Rushdie",
    "time": "00:00",
    "quote_first": "I was born in the city of Bombay … On the stroke of ",
    "quote_time_case": "midnight",
    "quote_last": ", as a matter of fact. Clock-hands joined palms in respectful greeting as I came. Oh, spell it out, spell it out: at the precise instant of India’s arrival at independence, I tumbled forth into the world.",
    "quoteSourceTitle": "Midnight's Children",
    "quoteAuthor": "Salman Rushdie",
    "sfw": "yes"
},

"$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-00:00-JK Rowling": {
    "title": "$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-00:00-JK Rowling",
    "time": "00:00",
    "quote_first": "It was nearing ",
    "quote_time_case": "midnight",
    "quote_last": " and the Prime Minister was sitting alone in his office, reading a long memo that was slipping through his brain without leaving the slightest trace of meaning behind.",
    "quoteSourceTitle": "Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince",
    "quoteAuthor": "JK Rowling",
    "sfw": "yes"
},

"$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-00:00-Charles Dickens": {
    "title": "$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-00:00-Charles Dickens",
    "time": "00:00",
    "quote_first": "To begin my life with the beginning of my life, I record that I was born (as I have been informed an believe) on a Friday, at ",
    "quote_time_case": "twelve o'clock",
    "quote_last": " at night. It was remarked that the clock began to strike, and I began to cry, simultaneously.",
    "quoteSourceTitle": "David Copperfield",
    "quoteAuthor": "Charles Dickens",
    "sfw": "yes"
},

"$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-00:00-Murakami": {
    "title": "$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-00:00-Murakami",
    "time": "00:00",
    "quote_first": "",
    "quote_time_case": "Midnight",
    "quote_last": " is approaching, and while the peak of activity has passed, the basal metabolism that maintains life continues undiminished, producing the basso continuo of the city’s moan, a monotonous sound that neither rises or falls but is pregnant with foreboding.",
    "quoteSourceTitle": "After Dark",
    "quoteAuthor": "Murakami",
    "sfw": "yes"
},

"$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-00:00-Edgar Allan Poe": {
    "title": "$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-00:00-Edgar Allan Poe",
    "time": "00:00",
    "quote_first": "Once upon a ",
    "quote_time_case": "midnight",
    "quote_last": " dreary, while I pondered weak and weary, Over many a quaint and curious volume of forgotten lore, While I nodded, nearly napping, suddenly there came a tapping, As of some one gently rapping, rapping at my chamber door. ‘Tis some visitor,’ I muttered, tapping at my chamber door - Only this, and nothing more.‘",
    "quoteSourceTitle": "The Raven",
    "quoteAuthor": "Edgar Allan Poe",
    "sfw": "yes"
},

"$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-00:00-Christopher Marlowe": {
    "title": "$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-00:00-Christopher Marlowe",
    "time": "00:00",
    "quote_first": "The clock striketh ",
    "quote_time_case": "twelve",
    "quote_last": " O it strikes, it strikes! Now body, turn to air, Or Lucifer will bear thee quick to hell. O soul, be changed into little water drops, And fall into the ocean, ne'er to be found. My God, my God, look not so fierce on me!",
    "quoteSourceTitle": "Dr Faustus",
    "quoteAuthor": "Christopher Marlowe",
    "sfw": "yes"
},

"$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-00:00-Laurence Sterne": {
    "title": "$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-00:00-Laurence Sterne",
    "time": "00:00",
    "quote_first": "The first night, as soon as the corporal had conducted my uncle Toby up stairs, which was about 10 - Mrs. Wadman threw herself into her arm chair, and crossing her left knee with her right, which formed a resting-place for her elbow, she reclin’d her cheek upon the palm of her hand, and leaning forwards, ruminated until ",
    "quote_time_case": "midnight",
    "quote_last": " upon both sides of the question.‘",
    "quoteSourceTitle": "The Life and Opinions of Tristram Shandy, Gentleman",
    "quoteAuthor": "Laurence Sterne",
    "sfw": "yes"
},

"$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-00:01-Donald A. Cabana": {
    "title": "$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-00:01-Donald A. Cabana",
    "time": "00:01",
    "quote_first": "With the appointed execution time of ",
    "quote_time_case": "one minute past midnight",
    "quote_last": " just seconds away, I knocked on the metal door twice. The lock turned and the door swiftly swung open.",
    "quoteSourceTitle": "Death at Midnight",
    "quoteAuthor": "Donald A. Cabana",
    "sfw": "yes"
},

"$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-00:02-Shashi Warrier": {
    "title": "$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-00:02-Shashi Warrier",
    "time": "00:02",
    "quote_first": "",
    "quote_time_case": "Two minutes past midnight",
    "quote_last": ". With me in the lead the fourteen other men of Teams Yellow, White and Red moved out of the clearing and separated for points along the wall where they would cross over into the grounds.",
    "quoteSourceTitle": "Night of the Krait",
    "quoteAuthor": "Shashi Warrier",
    "sfw": "yes"
},

"$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-00:03-Robert Tressell": {
    "title": "$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-00:03-Robert Tressell",
    "time": "00:03",
    "quote_first": "It was ",
    "quote_time_case": "after twelve o'clock",
    "quote_last": " when Easton came home. Ruth recognised his footsteps before he reached the house, and her heart seemed to stop beating when she heard the clang of the gate, as it closed after he had passed through.",
    "quoteSourceTitle": "The Ragged Trousered Philanthropists",
    "quoteAuthor": "Robert Tressell",
    "sfw": "yes"
},

"$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-00:03-George Jean Nathan": {
    "title": "$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-00:03-George Jean Nathan",
    "time": "00:03",
    "quote_first": "It was just ",
    "quote_time_case": "three minutes past midnight",
    "quote_last": " when I last saw Archer Harrison alive. I remember, because I said it was two minutes past and he looked at his watch and said it was three minutes past.",
    "quoteSourceTitle": "Since Ibsen",
    "quoteAuthor": "George Jean Nathan",
    "sfw": "yes"
},

"$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-00:03-Elizabeth Kostova": {
    "title": "$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-00:03-Elizabeth Kostova",
    "time": "00:03",
    "quote_first": "Suddenly I felt a great stillness in the air, then a snapping of tension. I glanced at my watch. ",
    "quote_time_case": "Three minutes after midnight.",
    "quote_last": " I was breathing normally and my pen moved freely across the page. Whatever stalked me wasn’t quite as clever as I’d feared, I thought, careful not to pause in my work.",
    "quoteSourceTitle": "The Historian",
    "quoteAuthor": "Elizabeth Kostova",
    "sfw": "yes"
},

"$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-00:04-Fred Sheehan": {
    "title": "$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-00:04-Fred Sheehan",
    "time": "00:04",
    "quote_first": "At ",
    "quote_time_case": "four minutes past midnight",
    "quote_last": ", January 22, Admiral Lowry’s armada of more than 250 ships reached the transport area off Anzio. The sea was calm, the night was black.",
    "quoteSourceTitle": "Anzio: Epic of Bravery",
    "quoteAuthor": "Fred Sheehan",
    "sfw": "yes"
},

"$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-00:05-David Foster Wallace": {
    "title": "$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-00:05-David Foster Wallace",
    "time": "00:05",
    "quote_first": "E.M. Security, normally so scrupulous with their fucking trucks at ",
    "quote_time_case": "0005h",
    "quote_last": "., is nowhere around, lending weight to yet another cliché. If you asked Gately what he was feeling right this second he’d have no idea.",
    "quoteSourceTitle": "Infinite Jest",
    "quoteAuthor": "David Foster Wallace",
    "sfw": "no"
},

"$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-00:06-Glenn Shirley": {
    "title": "$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-00:06-Glenn Shirley",
    "time": "00:06",
    "quote_first": "At ",
    "quote_time_case": "six minutes past midnight",
    "quote_last": ", death relieved the sufferer.",
    "quoteSourceTitle": "West of Hell's Fringe",
    "quoteAuthor": "Glenn Shirley",
    "sfw": "yes"
},

"$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-00:07-Mark Haddon": {
    "title": "$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-00:07-Mark Haddon",
    "time": "00:07",
    "quote_first": "It was ",
    "quote_time_case": "seven minutes after midnight",
    "quote_last": ". The dog was lying on the grass in the middle of the lawn in front of Mrs Shears' house. Its eyes were closed. It looked as if it was running on its side, the way dogs run when they think they are chasing a cat in a dream.",
    "quoteSourceTitle": "The Curious Incident of the Dog in the Night-Time",
    "quoteAuthor": "Mark Haddon",
    "sfw": "yes"
},

"$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-00:08-James Pascoe": {
    "title": "$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-00:08-James Pascoe",
    "time": "00:08",
    "quote_first": "“Hour of the night!” exclaimed the priest; “it is day, not night, and the hour is ",
    "quote_time_case": "eight past midnight",
    "quote_last": "!"",
    "quoteSourceTitle": "The Brigantine",
    "quoteAuthor": "James Pascoe",
    "sfw": "yes"
},

"$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-00:09-Amir Mir": {
    "title": "$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-00:09-Amir Mir",
    "time": "00:09",
    "quote_first": "At ",
    "quote_time_case": "12.09am",
    "quote_last": " on 18 October, the cavalcade had reached the Karsaz Bridge, still ten kilometres from her destination.",
    "quoteSourceTitle": "The Bhutto Murder Trail: From Waziristan to GHQ",
    "quoteAuthor": "Amir Mir",
    "sfw": "yes"
},

"$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-00:10-Jonathan Barrow": {
    "title": "$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-00:10-Jonathan Barrow",
    "time": "00:10",
    "quote_first": "It was at ",
    "quote_time_case": "ten minutes past midnight",
    "quote_last": ". Three police cars, Alsations and a black maria arrive at the farmhouse. The farmer clad only in a jock-strap, refused them entry.",
    "quoteSourceTitle": "The Queue",
    "quoteAuthor": "Jonathan Barrow",
    "sfw": "yes"
},

"$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-00:11-Gavin Mortimer": {
    "title": "$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-00:11-Gavin Mortimer",
    "time": "00:11",
    "quote_first": "The first incendiaries to hit St Thomas’s Hospital had splattered Riddell House at ",
    "quote_time_case": "eleven minutes past midnight",
    "quote_last": ", from where a few hours earlier the Archbishop of Canterbury had given ‘an inspiring address’.",
    "quoteSourceTitle": "The Longest Night",
    "quoteAuthor": "Gavin Mortimer",
    "sfw": "yes"
},

"$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-00:12-Thomas Pynchon": {
    "title": "$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-00:12-Thomas Pynchon",
    "time": "00:12",
    "quote_first": "Clock time is ",
    "quote_time_case": "0 Hours, 12 Minutes",
    "quote_last": ", 0 Seconds. Twenty three minutes later, they have their first sight of Venus. Each lies with his Eye clapp’d to the Snout of an identical two and a half foot Gregorian reflector made by Mr Short, with Darkening-Nozzles by Mr Bird.",
    "quoteSourceTitle": "Mason & Dixon",
    "quoteAuthor": "Thomas Pynchon",
    "sfw": "yes"
},

"$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-00:12-Fern Michaels": {
    "title": "$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-00:12-Fern Michaels",
    "time": "00:12",
    "quote_first": "It was ",
    "quote_time_case": "twelve minutes past midnight",
    "quote_last": " when mother and daughter saw the first lightning strike. It hit the main barn with such force the ground trembled under their feet.",
    "quoteSourceTitle": "Kentucky heat",
    "quoteAuthor": "Fern Michaels",
    "sfw": "yes"
},

"$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-00:14-Robert Ludlum": {
    "title": "$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-00:14-Robert Ludlum",
    "time": "00:14",
    "quote_first": "It was exactly ",
    "quote_time_case": "fourteen minutes past midnight",
    "quote_last": " when he completed the final call. Among the men he had reched were honourable men. Their voices would be heard by the President.",
    "quoteSourceTitle": "The Matarese Circle",
    "quoteAuthor": "Robert Ludlum",
    "sfw": "yes"
},

"$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-00:15-Dean Koontz": {
    "title": "$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-00:15-Dean Koontz",
    "time": "00:15",
    "quote_first": "At ",
    "quote_time_case": "twelve-fifteen",
    "quote_last": " he got out of the van. He tucked the pistol under the waistband of his trousers and crossed the silent, deserted street to the Hudston house. He let himself through an unlocked wooden gate onto a side patio brightened only by moonlight filtered through the leafy branches of an enormous sheltering coral tree. He paused to pull on a pair of supple leather gloves.",
    "quoteSourceTitle": "Watchers",
    "quoteAuthor": "Dean Koontz",
    "sfw": "yes"
},

"$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-00:16-Gavin Mortimer": {
    "title": "$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-00:16-Gavin Mortimer",
    "time": "00:16",
    "quote_first": "At ",
    "quote_time_case": "sixteen minutes past midnight",
    "quote_last": ", Block 4 was hit and the roof set alight.",
    "quoteSourceTitle": "The Longest Night",

    "quote_last": " when Father arrived at the police station. I did not see him until 1:28am but I knew he was there because I could hear him. He was shouting, ‘I want to see my son,’ and ‘Why the hell is he locked up?’ and, ‘Of course I’m bloody angry.'",

"$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-01:15-James Thurber": {
    "title": "$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-01:15-James Thurber",
    "time": "01:15",
    "quote_first": "The ghost that got into our house on the night of November 17, 1915, raised such a hullabaloo of misunderstandings that I am sorry I didn’t just let it keep on walking, and go to bed. Its advent caused my mother to throw a shoe through a window of the house next door and ended up with my grandfather shooting a patrolman. I am sorry, therefore, as I have said, that I ever paid any attention to the footsteps. They began about a ",
    "quote_time_case": "quarter past one",
    "quote_last": " o'clock in the morning, a rhythmic, quick-cadenced walking around the dining-room table.",
    "quoteSourceTitle": "My Life and Hard Times: \"The Night the Ghost Got In\"",
    "quoteAuthor": "James Thurber",
    "sfw": "yes"
},

    "time": "01:17",
    "quote_first": "The clocks stopped at ",
    "quote_time_case": "1:17",
    "quote_last": ". A long shear of light and then a series of low concussions. He got up and went to the window. What is it? she said. He didnt answer. He went into the bathroom and threw the lightswitch but the power was already gone. A dull rose glow in the windowglass. He dropped to one knee and raised the lever to stop the tub and then turned on both taps as far as they would go. She was standing in the doorway in her nightwear, clutching the jamb, cradling her belly in one hand. What is it? she said. What is happening?",
    "quoteSourceTitle": "The Road",

    "sfw": "yes"
},

"$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-01:20-P.G. Wodehouse": {
    "title": "$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-01:20-P.G. Wodehouse",
    "time": "01:20",
    "quote_first": "“Well!” she said, looking like a minor female prophet about to curse the sins of the people. “May I trespass on your valuable time long enough to ask what in the name of everything bloodsome you think you’re playing at, young piefaced Bertie? It is now some ",
    "quote_time_case": "twenty minutes past one",
    "quote_last": " o'clock in the morning, and not a spot of action on your part.”",
    "quoteSourceTitle": "Jeeves and the Feudal Spirit",
    "quoteAuthor": "P.G. Wodehouse",
    "sfw": "yes"
},

    "title": "$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-01:20-Mark Haddon",
    "time": "01:20",
    "quote_first": "Then it was ",
    "quote_time_case": "1.20am",
    "quote_last": ", but I hadn’t heard Father come upstairs to bed. I wondered if he was asleep downstairs or whether he was waiting to come in and kill me. So I got out my Swiss Army Knife and opened the saw blade so that I could defend myself.",
    "quoteSourceTitle": "The Curious Incident Of The Dog In The Night-Time",
    "quoteAuthor": "Mark Haddon",
    "sfw": "yes"
},

    "time": "02:05",
    "quote_first": "Then he began ringing the bell. In about ten minutes his valet appeared, half dressed, and looking very drowsy. ‘I am sorry to have had to wake you up, Francis,’ he said, stepping in; ‘but I had forgotten my latch-key. What time is it?’ ‘",

    "quoteAuthor": "Oscar Wilde",
    "sfw": "yes"
},

    "time": "02:10",
    "quote_first": "Decided to get under way again as soon as there is any clearance. Snowing and blowing, force about fifty or sixty miles an hour. February 26, Saturday - Richards went out 1:10am and found it clearing a bit, so we got under way as soon as possible, which was ",

    "title": "$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-02:12-HP Lovecraft",
    "time": "02:12",
    "quote_first": "Then the lights went out all over the city. It happened at ",
    "quote_time_case": "2.12am",
    "quote_last": " according to power-house records, but Blake’s diary gives no indication of the time. The entry is merely, ‘Lights out - God help me.’",

    "sfw": "yes"
},

    "title": "$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-02:13-Chris James",
    "time": "02:13",
    "quote_first": "Now, listen: your destination is Friday, 4 August 1944, and the window will punch through at 22.30 hours. You’re going to a dimension that diverged from our own at ",
    "quote_time_case": "02.13",
    "quote_last": " on the morning of Wednesday 20 February 1918, over twenty-six years earlier. You don’t know what it’s going to be like…",
    "quoteSourceTitle": "The Second Internet Cafe, Part 1: The Dimension Researcher",
    "quoteAuthor": "Chris James",
    "sfw": "yes"
},

    "quote_first": "It did. When the alarm rang at ",

"$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-02:17-Jonathan Franzen": {

    "time": "02:17",
    "quote_first": "“What time is it now?” He turned her very dusty alarm clock to check. “",
    "quote_time_case": "Two-seventeen",
    "quote_last": ",” he marveled. It was the strangest time he’d seen in his entire life. “I apologize that the room is so messy,” Lalitha said. “I like it. I love how you are. Are you hungry? I’m a little hungry.” “No, Walter.” She smiled. “I’m not hungry. But I can get you something.” “I was thinking, like, a glass of soy milk. Soy beverage."",
    "quoteSourceTitle": "Freedom",

    "sfw": "yes"
},

    "time": "02:17",

    "time": "02:21",
    "quote_first": "It was the urge to look up at the sky. But of course there was no sun nor moon nor stars overhead. Darkness hung heavy over me.     "quote_time_case": "Two-twenty-one",

    "time": "02:30",
    "quote_first": "“Get into the mood, Shirl!” Lew said. “The party’s already started! Yippee! You dressed for a party, Harry?” “Yep. What’re you wearing, Shirl?” “My old drum majorette’s outfit. The one I wore to the State Finals. Listen, we can’t tie up the phones like this.” “Why not?” said Harry. “Who’s going to call at ",
    "quote_time_case": "2:30 a.m.",

    "quote_first": "",
    "quote_time_case": "At three am",
    "quote_last": " I was walking the floor and listening to Katchaturian working in a tractor factory. He called it a violin concerto. I called it a loose fan belt and the hell with it.",
    "quoteSourceTitle": "The Long Goodbye",
    "quoteAuthor": "Raymond Chandler",

"$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-03:00-Russell Hoban": {
    "title": "$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-03:00-Russell Hoban",
    "time": "03:00",
    "quote_first": "At ",
    "quote_time_case": "three o' clock in the morning",
    "quote_last": " Eurydice is bound to come into it. After all, why did I sit here like a telegrapher at a lost outpost if not to receive messages from everywhere about the lost Eurydice who was never mine to begin with but whom I lamented and sought continually both professionally and amateurishly. This is not a digression. Where I am at three o' clock in the morning - and by now every hour is three o' clock in the morning - there are no digressions, it’s all one thing.",
    "quoteSourceTitle": "The Medusa Frequency",
    "quoteAuthor": "Russell Hoban",
    "sfw": "yes"
},

"$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-03:00-F. Scott Fitzgerald": {
    "title": "$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-03:00-F. Scott Fitzgerald",
    "time": "03:00",
    "quote_first": "In a real dark night of the soul it is always ",
    "quote_time_case": "3 o'clock",
    "quote_last": " in the morning.",
    "quoteSourceTitle": "The Crack-Up",
    "quoteAuthor": "F. Scott Fitzgerald",
    "sfw": "yes"
},

"$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-03:00-Amit Chaudhuri": {
    "title": "$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-03:00-Amit Chaudhuri",
    "time": "03:00",
    "quote_first": "Early mornings, my mother is about, drifting in her pale nightie, making herself a cup of tea in the kitchen. Water begins to boil in the kettle; it starts as a private, secluded sound, pure as rain, and grows to a steady, solipsistic bubbling. Not till she has had one cup of tea, so weak that it has a colour accidentally golden, can she begin her day. She is an insomniac. Her nights are wide-eyed and excited with worry. Even at ",
    "quote_time_case": "three o'clock",
    "quote_last": " in the morning one might hear her eating a Bain Marie biscuit in the kitchen.",
    "quoteSourceTitle": "Afternoon Raag",
    "quoteAuthor": "Amit Chaudhuri",
    "sfw": "yes"
},

"$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-03:00-Dan Holloway": {

"$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-03:00-Philip Roth": {
    "title": "$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-03:00-Philip Roth",
    "time": "03:00",
    "quote_first": "It was six untroubled days later – the best days at the camp so far, lavish July light thickly spread everywhere, six masterpiece mountain midsummer days, one replicating the other – that someone stumbled jerkily, as if his ankles were in chains, to the Comanche cabin’s bathroom ",
    "quote_time_case": "at three A.M.",
    "quote_last": "",
    "quoteSourceTitle": "Nemesis",
    "quoteAuthor": "Philip Roth",
    "sfw": "yes"
},

"$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-03:00-Ian McEwan": {
    "title": "$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-03:00-Ian McEwan",
    "time": "03:00",
    "quote_first": "It was ",
    "quote_time_case": "three in the morning",
    "quote_last": " when his taxi stopped by giant mounds of snow outside his hotel. He had not eaten in hours.",
    "quoteSourceTitle": "Solar",
    "quoteAuthor": "Ian McEwan",
    "sfw": "yes"
},

"$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-03:00-Max Frisch": {
    "title": "$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-03:00-Max Frisch",
    "time": "03:00",
    "quote_first": "Once I saw a figure I shall never forget. It was ",
    "quote_time_case": "three o'clock at night",
    "quote_last": ", as I was going home from Blacky as usual; it was a short-cut for me, and there would be nobody in the street at this time of night, I thought, especially not in this frightful cold.",
    "quoteSourceTitle": "I'm Not Stiller",
    "quoteAuthor": "Max Frisch",
    "sfw": "yes"
},

"$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-03:00-Philip K Dick": {
    "title": "$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-03:00-Philip K Dick",
    "time": "03:00",
    "quote_first": "Roused from her sleep, Freya Gaines groped for the switch of the vidphone; groggily she found it and snapped it on. ‘Lo,’ she mumbled, wondering what time it was. She made out the luminous dial of the clock beside the bed. ",
    "quote_time_case": "Three AM.",
    "quote_last": " Good grief.",
    "quoteSourceTitle": "The Game Players of Titan",
    "quoteAuthor": "Philip K Dick",
    "sfw": "yes"
},

"$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-03:00-David Foster Wallace": {
    "title": "$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-03:00-David Foster Wallace",
    "time": "03:00",
    "quote_first": "Schact clears his mouth and swallows mightily. ‘Tavis can’t even regrout tile in the locker room without calling a Community meeting or appointing a committee. The Regrouting Committee’s been dragging along since may. Suddenly they’re pulling secret ",
    "quote_time_case": "0300",
    "quote_last": " milk-switches? It doesn’t ring true, Jim.",

    "quoteAuthor": "David Foster Wallace",
    "sfw": "yes"
},

"$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-03:00-Jerome K Jerome": {
    "title": "$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-03:00-Jerome K Jerome",
    "time": "03:00",
    "quote_first": "What’s the time?“ said the man, eyeing George up and down with evident suspicion; "why, if you listen you will hear it strike.” George listened, and a neighbouring clock immediately obliged. “But it’s only gone ",
    "quote_time_case": "three",
    "quote_last": "!” said George in an injured tone, when it had finished.",
    "quoteSourceTitle": "Three Men in a Boat",
    "quoteAuthor": "Jerome K Jerome",
    "sfw": "yes"
},

"$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-03:00-Paula Fox": {
    "title": "$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-03:00-Paula Fox",
    "time": "03:00",
    "quote_first": "When Sophie awoke, it was ",

    "quoteSourceTitle": "Desperate Characters",

"$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-03:00-George Eliot": {
    "title": "$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-03:00-George Eliot",
    "time": "03:00",
    "quote_first": "You hearken, Missy. It’s ",
    "quote_time_case": "three o’clock",
    "quote_last": " in the morning and I’ve got all my faculties as well as ever I had in my life. I know all my property and where the money’s put out. And I’ve made everything ready to change my mind, and do as I like at the last. Do you hear, Missy? I’ve got my faculties.”",
    "quoteSourceTitle": "Middlemarch",
    "quoteAuthor": "George Eliot",
    "sfw": "yes"
},

"$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-03:01-Ernest Hemingway": {
    "title": "$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-03:01-Ernest Hemingway",
    "time": "03:01",
    "quote_first": "It was now ",
    "quote_time_case": "about three o'clock",
    "quote_last": " in the morning and Francis Macomber, who had been asleep a little while after he had stopped thinking about the lion, wakened and then slept again.",
    "quoteSourceTitle": "The Short Happy Life of Francis Macomber",
    "quoteAuthor": "Ernest Hemingway",
    "sfw": "yes"
},

"$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-03:04-Henning Mankell": {
    "title": "$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-03:04-Henning Mankell",
    "time": "03:04",
    "quote_first": "…his back-up alarm clock rang. He looked at his front-line clock on the bedside table and noted that it had stopped at ",
    "quote_time_case": "3.04",
    "quote_last": ". So, you couldn’t even rely on alarm clocks.",
    "quoteSourceTitle": "The Return of the Dancing Master",

    "sfw": "yes"
},

"$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-03:05-Jonathan Franzen": {
    "title": "$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-03:05-Jonathan Franzen",
    "time": "03:05",
    "quote_first": "On the Sunday before Christmas she awoke at ",
    "quote_time_case": "3:05 a.m.",
    "quote_last": " and though: Thirty-six hours. Four hours later she got up thinking: Thirty-two hours. Late in the day she took Alfred to the street-association Christmas party at Dale and Honey Driblett’s, sat him down safely with Kirby Root, and proceeded to remind all her neighbors that her favorite grandson, who’d been looking forward all year to a Christmas in St. Jude, was arriving tomorrow afternoon.",
    "quoteSourceTitle": "The Corrections",
    "quoteAuthor": "Jonathan Franzen",
    "sfw": "yes"
},

    "quote_time_case": "3.07am",

    "quote_first": "I think my credit card was in there too. I wrote down the words credit card and said that if they wouldn’t let me cancel them I’d demand that they registered the loss so you couldn’t be charge for anything beyond the time of my calling them up. I looked at the clock. It was ",

    "sfw": "yes"

    "time": "03:14",
    "quote_first": "Since he had told the girl that it had to end, he’d been waking up every morning at ",

    "title": "$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-03:15-JG Ballard",
    "time": "03:15",
    "quote_first": "Above the door of Room 69 the clock ticked on at ",
    "quote_time_case": "3:15",

"$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-03:17-Donna Tartt": {
    "title": "$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-03:17-Donna Tartt",
    "time": "03:17",
    "quote_first": "The two of us sat there, listening—Boris more intently than me. “Who’s that with him then?” I said. “Some whore.” He listened for a moment, brow furrowed, his profile sharp in the moonlight, and then lay back down. “Two of them.” I rolled over, and checked my iPod. It was ",
    "quote_time_case": "3:17",
    "quote_last": " in the morning.",
    "quoteSourceTitle": "The Goldfinch",
    "quoteAuthor": "Donna Tartt",
    "sfw": "yes"

    "title": "$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-03:17-Catherine O'Flynn",
    "time": "03:17",
    "quote_first": "He turned to the monitors again and flicked through the screens, each one able to display eight different camera mountings, giving Kurt 192 different still lives of Green Oaks at ",

"$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-03:36-Richard C Matheson": {
    "title": "$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-03:36-Richard C Matheson",
    "time": "03:36",
    "quote_first": "As I near Deadhorse, it’s ",
    "quote_time_case": "3:36 a.m.",

    "quoteSourceTitle": "Zoopraxis",

    "time": "03:37",
    "quote_first": "It was three ",
    "quote_time_case": "thirty-seven A.M.",

    "sfw": "yes"

    "time": "03:38",
    "quote_first": "At ",
    "quote_time_case": "3.38am",

    "quoteSourceTitle": "Just Like the Ones we Used to Know",
    "quoteAuthor": "Connie Willis",
    "sfw": "yes"
},

"$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-03:39-William Jablonsky": {
    "title": "$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-03:39-William Jablonsky",
    "time": "03:39",
    "quote_first": "23 October 1893 ",
    "quote_time_case": "3.39am.",
    "quote_last": " Upon further thought, I feel it necessary to explain that exile into the Master’s workshop is not an unpleasant fate. It is not simply some bare-walled cellar devoid of stimulation - quite the opposite.",
    "quoteSourceTitle": "The Clockwork man",
    "quoteAuthor": "William Jablonsky",
    "sfw": "yes"
},

"$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-03:40-Ian McEwan": {
    "title": "$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-03:40-Ian McEwan",
    "time": "03:40",
    "quote_first": "His bedside clock shows ",
    "quote_time_case": "three forty",
    "quote_last": ". He has no idea what he’s doing out of bed: he has no need to relieve himself, nor is he disturbed by a dream or some element of the day before, or even by the state of the world.",
    "quoteSourceTitle": "Saturday",
    "quoteAuthor": "Ian McEwan",
    "sfw": "yes"
},

"$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-03:41-Henning Mankell": {
    "title": "$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-03:41-Henning Mankell",
    "time": "03:41",
    "quote_first": "The alarm clock said ",
    "quote_time_case": "3.41am.",

    "quoteSourceTitle": "The Dogs of Riga",
    "quoteAuthor": "Henning Mankell",
    "sfw": "yes"

"$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-03:42-Stephen Crane": {

    "quote_first": "“We are due in Yellow Sky at ",
    "quote_time_case": "3:42",

    "quoteSourceTitle": "Bride Comes to Yellow Sky",
    "quoteAuthor": "Stephen Crane",

"$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-03:43-David Mitchell": {

    "quote_first": "The clock says ",
    "quote_time_case": "3.43am.",

    "quoteAuthor": "David Mitchell",

"$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-03:44-Will Self": {

    "time": "03:44",
    "quote_first": "It was dark. After she had switched the light on and been to the toilet, she checked her watch: ",
    "quote_time_case": "3.44 a.m.",
    "quote_last": " She undressed, put the cat out the door and returned to the twin bed.",
    "quoteSourceTitle": "Liver: Leberknödel",
    "quoteAuthor": "Will Self",
    "sfw": "yes"
},

"$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-03:45-Oscar Wilde": {
    "title": "$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-03:45-Oscar Wilde",
    "time": "03:45",
    "quote_first": "LORD CAVERSHAM: Well, sir! what are you doing here? Wasting your life as usual! You should be in bed, sir. You keep too late hours! I heard of you the other night at Lady Rufford’s dancing till four o' clock in the morning! LORD GORING: Only a ",
    "quote_time_case": "quarter to four",
    "quote_last": ", father.",
    "quoteSourceTitle": "An Ideal Husband",
    "quoteAuthor": "Oscar Wilde",
    "sfw": "yes"
},

"$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-03:47-Mark Haddon": {
    "title": "$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-03:47-Mark Haddon",
    "time": "03:47",
    "quote_first": "I stayed awake until ",
    "quote_time_case": "3:47",
    "quote_last": ". That was the last time I looked at my watch before I fell asleep. It has a luminous face and lights up if you press a button so I could read it in the dark. I was cold and I was frightened Father might come out and find me. But I felt safer in the garden because I was hidden.",
    "quoteSourceTitle": "The Curious Incident Of The Dog In The Night-Time",
    "quoteAuthor": "Mark Haddon",
    "sfw": "yes"
},

"$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-03:49-Len Deighton": {
    "title": "$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-03:49-Len Deighton",
    "time": "03:49",
    "quote_first": "It was ",
    "quote_time_case": "3.49",
    "quote_last": " when he hit me because of the two hundred times I had said, “I don’t know.” He hit me a lot after that.",
    "quoteSourceTitle": "The Ipcress File",
    "quoteAuthor": "Len Deighton",
    "sfw": "yes"
},

"$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-03:50-Peter Robb": {
    "title": "$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-03:50-Peter Robb",
    "time": "03:50",
    "quote_first": "She had used her cell phone to leave several messages on the answering machine in Sao Paulo of the young dentist of the previous evening, whose name was Fernando. The first was recorded at ",

    "time": "03:57",
    "quote_first": "Certain facts were apparent: dark; cold; thundering boots; quilts; pillow; light under the door – the materials of reality - but I could not pin these materials down in time. And the raw materials of reality without that glue of time are materials adrift and reality is as meaningless as the balsa parts of a model airplane scattered to the wind…I am in my old room, yes, in the dark, certainly, and it is cold, obviously, but what time is it? “",
    "quote_time_case": "Nearly four",

"$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-03:58-Wilson Harris": {
    "title": "$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-03:58-Wilson Harris",
    "time": "03:58",
    "quote_first": "The ancient house was deserted, the crumbling garage padlocked, and one was just able to discern - by peering through a crack in the bubbling sun on the window - the face of a clock on the opposite wall. The clock had stopped at ",
    "quote_time_case": "two minutes to four",
    "quote_last": " early in the morning, or who could tell, it may have been earlier still, yesterday in the afternoon, a couple of hours after Kaiser had left Kamaria for Bartica.",
    "quoteSourceTitle": "Heartland",
    "quoteAuthor": "Wilson Harris",
    "sfw": "yes"
},

    "quote_first": "Waking ",
    "quote_time_case": "at four",
    "quote_last": " to soundless dark, I stare. In time the curtain-edges will grow light. Till then I see what’s really always there: Unresting death, a whole day nearer now, Making all thought impossible but how And where and when I shall myself die.",

    "time": "04:00",
    "quote_first": "When he noticed that the chefs from the grand hotels and restaurants - a picky, impatient bunch - tended to move around from seller to seller, buying apples here and broccoli there, he asked if he could have tea available for them. Tommy agreed, and the chefs, grateful for a hot drink ",
    "quote_time_case": "at four",
    "quote_last": " in the morning, lingered and bought.",
    "quoteSourceTitle": "The Tea Rose",

    "sfw": "yes"

    "quote_time_case": "4.07am.",
    "quote_last": " Why am I standing? My shoulders feel cold and I’m shivering. I become aware that I’m standing in the middle of the room. I immediately look at the bedroom door. Closed, with no signs of a break-in. Why did I get up?",

"$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-04:12-Haruki Murakami": {
    "title": "$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-04:12-Haruki Murakami",
    "time": "04:12",
    "quote_first": "Finally, she signalled with her light that she’d made it to the top. I signalled back, then shined the light downward to see how far the water had risen. I couldn’t make out a thing. My watch read ",
    "quote_time_case": "four-twelve",
    "quote_last": " in the morning. Not yet dawn. The morning papers still not delivered, trains not yet running, citizens of the surface world fast asleep, oblivious to all this. I pulled the rope taut with both hands, took a deep breath, then slowly began my climb.",
    "quoteSourceTitle": "Hard Boiled Wonderland and the End of the World",
    "quoteAuthor": "Haruki Murakami",
    "sfw": "yes"
},

    "title": "$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-04:12-Elmore Leonard",
    "time": "04:12",
    "quote_first": "Karen felt the bed move beneath Harry’s weight. Lying on her side she opened her eyes to see digital numbers in the dark, ",
    "quote_time_case": "4:12",

    "time": "04:15",
    "quote_first": "Alice wants to warn her that a defect runs in the family, like flat feet or diabetes: they’re all in danger of ending up alone by their own stubborn choice. The ugly kitchen clock says ",

    "time": "04:16",
    "quote_first": "I stooped to pick up my watch from the floor. ",
    "quote_time_case": "Four-sixteen",
    "quote_last": ". Another hour until dawn. I went to the telephone and dialled my own number. It’d been a long time since I’d called home, so I had to struggle to remember the number. I let it ring fifteen times; no answer. I hung up, dialled again, and let it ring another fifteen times. Nobody.",
    "quoteSourceTitle": "Hard Boiled Wonderland and the End of the World",
    "quoteAuthor": "Haruki Murakami",
    "sfw": "yes"

"$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-04:16-Maree Anderson": {

    "quote_first": "He awoke at ",

    "sfw": "yes"

"$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-04:18-Haruki Murakami": {

    "time": "04:18",
    "quote_first": "I grabbed the alarm clock, threw it on my lap, and slapped the red and black buttons with both hands. The ringing didn’t stop. The telephone! The clock read ",
    "quote_time_case": "four-eighteen",
    "quote_last": ". It was dark outside. Four-eighteen a.m. I got out of bed and picked up the receiver. “Hello?”",
    "quoteSourceTitle": "Hard Boiled Wonderland and the End of the World",
    "quoteAuthor": "Haruki Murakami",
    "sfw": "yes"
},

"$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-04:30-Alain de Botton": {

    "time": "04:30",
    "quote_first": "At the end of a relationship, it is the one who is not in love who makes the tender speeches. I was overwhelmed by a sense of betrayal, betrayal because a union in which I had invested so much had been declared bankrupt without my feeling it to be so. Chloe had not given it a chance, I argued with myself, knowing the hopelessness of these inner courts announcing hollow verdicts at ",
    "quote_time_case": "four thirty",
    "quote_last": " in the morning.",
    "quoteSourceTitle": "Essays on Love",
    "quoteAuthor": "Alain de Botton",
    "sfw": "yes"

"$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-04:30-David Foster Wallace": {
    "title": "$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-04:30-David Foster Wallace",
    "time": "04:30",
    "quote_first": "Tonight Clenette H. and the deeply whacked out Yolanda W. come back in from Footprints around 2315 in purple skirts and purple lipstick and ironed hair, tottering on heels and telling each other what a wicked time they just had. Hester Thrale undulates in in a false fox jacket at 2330 as usual even though she has to be up at like ",
    "quote_time_case": "0430",
    "quote_last": " for the breakfast shift at the Provident Nursing Home and sometimes eats breakfast with Gately, both their faces nodding perilously close to their Frosted Flakes.",
    "quoteSourceTitle": "Infinite Jest",
    "quoteAuthor": "David Foster Wallace",
    "sfw": "yes"

    "title": "$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-04:45-Henning Mankell",
    "time": "04:45",
    "quote_first": "His wife’s breathing at his side is so faint that he can scarcely hear it. One of these mornings she’ll be lying dead beside me and I won’t even notice, he thinks. Or maybe it’ll be me. Daybreak will reveal that one of us has been left alone. He checks the clock on the table next to the bed. The hands glow and register ",
    "quote_time_case": "4:45 a.m.",
    "quote_last": "",
    "quoteSourceTitle": "Faceless Killers",
    "quoteAuthor": "Henning Mankell",
    "sfw": "yes"

"$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-04:46-Haruki Murakami": {
    "title": "$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-04:46-Haruki Murakami",
    "time": "04:46",
    "quote_first": "The phone rang again at ",
    "quote_time_case": "four-forty-six",
    "quote_last": ".“Hello,” I said. “Hello,” came a woman’s voice. “Sorry about the time before. There’s a disturbance in the sound field. Sometimes the sound goes away.” “The sound goes away?” “Yes,” she said. “The sound field’s slipping. Can you hear me?” “Loud and clear,” I said. It was the granddaughter of that kooky old scientist who’d given me the unicorn skull. The girl in the pink suit.",
    "quoteSourceTitle": "Hard Boiled Wonderland and the End of the World",
    "quoteAuthor": "Haruki Murakami",
    "sfw": "yes"
},

"$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-04:48-Sarah Kane": {

"$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-04:50-James Thurber": {
    "title": "$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-04:50-James Thurber",
    "time": "04:50",
    "quote_first": "Even the hands of his watch and the hands of all the thirteen clocks were frozen. They had all frozen at the same time, on a snowy night, seven years before, and after that it was always ",

    "quote_last": " in the castle.",
    "quoteSourceTitle": "The 13 Clocks",
    "quoteAuthor": "James Thurber",
    "sfw": "yes"
},

    "time": "04:54",
    "quote_first": "",
    "quote_time_case": "Six minutes to five",
    "quote_last": ". Six minutes to go. Suddenly I felt quite clearheaded. There was an unexpected light in the cell; the boundaries were drawn, the roles well defined. The time of doubt and questioning and uncertainty was over.",
    "quoteSourceTitle": "Dawn: A Novel",
    "quoteAuthor": "Elie Wiesel",
    "sfw": "yes"
},

    "time": "04:58",

    "quote_time_case": "Two minutes to five",

    "quoteAuthor": "Elie Wiesel",
    "sfw": "yes"
},

I had risen half-an-hour before her entrance, and had washed my face, and put on my clothes by the light of a half-moon just setting, whose rays streamed through the narrow window near my crib.",
    "quoteSourceTitle": "Jane Eyre",

"$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-05:00-H.P. Lovecraft": {
    "title": "$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-05:00-H.P. Lovecraft",
    "time": "05:00",
    "quote_first": "It was in the township of Dunwich, in a large and hardly inhabited farmhouse set against a hillside 4 miles from the village and a mile and a half from any other dwelling, that Wilbur Whately was born at ",
    "quote_time_case": "5 a.m.",
    "quote_last": " on Sunday, 2 February, 1913. The date was recalled because it was Candlemas, which people in Dunwich curiously observe under another name…",
    "quoteSourceTitle": "The Dunwich Horror",
    "quoteAuthor": "H.P. Lovecraft",
    "sfw": "yes"

    "time": "05:00",
    "quote_first": "Just after ",
    "quote_time_case": "five o'clock",
    "quote_last": " on this chill September morning, the fishmonger’s cart, containing Kirsten and Emilia and such possessions as they have been able to assemble in the time allowed to them, is driven out of the gates of Rosenborg?",

},

"$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-05:00-James Thurber": {

    "time": "05:00",
    "quote_first": "The cold eye of the Duke was dazzled by the gleaming of a thousand jewels that sparkled on the table. His ears were filled with chiming as the clocks began to strike. “One!” said Hark. “Two!” cried Zorn of Zorna. “Three!” the Duke’s voice almost whispered. ‘Four!“ sighed Saralinda. "",
    "quote_time_case": "Five",
    "quote_last": "!” the Golux crowed, and pointed at the table. “The task is done, the terms are met,” he said.",
    "quoteSourceTitle": "The 13 Clocks",

    "sfw": "yes"
},

    "time": "05:00",
    "quote_first": "The day came slow, till ",
    "quote_time_case": "five o'clock",
    "quote_last": ". Then sprang before the hills. Like hindered rubies, or the light. A sudden musket spills",

"$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-05:00-Fleur Adcock": {
    "title": "$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-05:00-Fleur Adcock",
    "time": "05:00",
    "quote_first": "There are worse things than having behaved foolishly in public. There are worse things than these miniature betrayals, committed or endured or suspected; there are worse things than not being able to sleep for thinking about them. It is ",
    "quote_time_case": "5 a.m.",
    "quote_last": " All the worse things come stalking in and stand icily about the bed looking worse and worse and worse.",
    "quoteSourceTitle": "Things",
    "quoteAuthor": "Fleur Adcock",
    "sfw": "yes"
},

"$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-05:00-William Makepeace Thackeray": {
    "title": "$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-05:00-William Makepeace Thackeray",
    "time": "05:00",
    "quote_first": "What causes young people to “come out,” but the noble ambition of matrimony? What sends them trooping to watering-places? What keeps them dancing till ",

    "quote_last": " in the morning through a whole mortal season?",
    "quoteSourceTitle": "Vanity Fair",

    "sfw": "yes"
},

"$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-05:09-Louis Joseph Vance": {
    "title": "$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-05:09-Louis Joseph Vance",
    "time": "05:09",
    "quote_first": "The primal flush of triumph which had saturated the American’s humor on this signal success, proved but fictive and transitory when inquiry of the station attendants educed the information that the two earliest trains to be obtained were the ",

"$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-05:10-Wilkie Collins": {
    "title": "$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-05:10-Wilkie Collins",
    "time": "05:10",
    "quote_first": "“Oh, my husband, I have done the deed which will relieve you of the wife whom you hate! I have taken the poison–all of it that was left in the paper packet, which was the first that I found. If this is not enough to kill me, I have more left in the bottle. ",
    "quote_time_case": "Ten minutes past five",
    "quote_last": ". "You have just gone, after giving me my composing draught. My courage failed me at the sight of you. I thought to myself, ‘If he look at me kindly, I will confess what I have done, and let him save my life.’ You never looked at me at all. You only looked at the medicine. I let you go without saying a word.",
    "quoteSourceTitle": "The Law and the Lady",
    "quoteAuthor": "Wilkie Collins",
    "sfw": "yes"
},

    "quote_first": "At ",

"$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-05:13-Nakia D Johnson": {
    "title": "$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-05:13-Nakia D Johnson",
    "time": "05:13",
    "quote_first": "Lying on my side in bed, I stared at my alarm clock until it became a blemish, its red hue glowing like a welcome sign beckoning me into the depths of hell’s crimson-colored cavities. ",
    "quote_time_case": "5:13 am.",
    "quote_last": " To describe this Monday as a blue Monday was an understatement.",

    "quote_time_case": "5.14am",

    "time": "05:15",
    "quote_first": "By the first week of May, Ralph was waking up to birdsong at ",
    "quote_time_case": "5:15 a.m.",
    "quote_last": " He tried earplugs for a few nights, although he doubted from the outset that they would work. It wasn’t the newly returned birds that were waking him up, nor the occasional delivery-truck backfire out on Harris Avenue. He had always been the sort of guy who could sleep in the middle of a brass marching bad, and he didn’t think that had changed. What had changed was inside his head.",
    "quoteSourceTitle": "Insomnia",
    "quoteAuthor": "Stephen King",
    "sfw": "yes"
},

    "quote_first": "Early in the morning, late in the century, Cricklewood Broadway. At ",
    "quote_time_case": "0627 hours",
    "quote_last": " on January 1, 1975, Alfred Archibald Jones was dressed in corduroy and sat in a fume-filled Cavalier Musketeer Estate, facedown on the steering wheel, hoping the judgment would not be too heavy upon him.",
    "quoteSourceTitle": "White Teeth",
    "quoteAuthor": "Zadie Smith",
    "sfw": "yes"
},

"$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-06:29-Raymond Chandler": {
    "title": "$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-06:29-Raymond Chandler",
    "time": "06:29",
    "quote_first": "I sat up. There was a rug over me. I threw that off and got my feet on the floor. I scowled at a clock. The clock said ",
    "quote_time_case": "a minute short of six-thirty",
    "quote_last": ".",
    "quoteSourceTitle": "The Big Sleep",
    "quoteAuthor": "Raymond Chandler",
    "sfw": "yes"
},

"$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-06:30-Sophie McKenzie": {
    "title": "$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-06:30-Sophie McKenzie",
    "time": "06:30",
    "quote_first": "Inside now MJ ordered. She pushed the three of us into the hotel room, thern shut the soor. I glanced at the clock by the bed. ",
    "quote_time_case": "6.30 am.",
    "quote_last": " Why were they waking Mum and Dad up this early?",
    "quoteSourceTitle": "Girl Missing",
    "quoteAuthor": "Sophie McKenzie",
    "sfw": "yes"
},

"$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-06:30-E.L. Doctorow": {
    "title": "$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-06:30-E.L. Doctorow",
    "time": "06:30",
    "quote_first": "Daniel and the FBI men listened to the sounds of his mother waking up his father. Daniel still held the door-knob. He was ready to close the door the second he was told to.“What time is it?” said his father in a drugged voice. “Oh my God, it’s ",
    "quote_time_case": "six-thirty",
    "quote_last": ",” his mother said.",
    "quoteSourceTitle": "The Book of Daniel",
    "quoteAuthor": "E.L. Doctorow",
    "sfw": "yes"
},

"$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-06:30-Christina Stead": {
    "title": "$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-06:30-Christina Stead",
    "time": "06:30",
    "quote_first": "It was ",
    "quote_time_case": "six-thirty",
    "quote_last": ". When the baby’s cry came, they could not pick it out, and Sam, eagerly thrusting his face amongst their ears, said, “Listen, there, there, that’s the new baby.” He was red with delight and success.",
    "quoteSourceTitle": "The Man Who Loved Children",
    "quoteAuthor": "Christina Stead",
    "sfw": "yes"
},

"$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-06:30-Cormac McCarthy": {
    "title": "$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-06:30-Cormac McCarthy",
    "time": "06:30",
    "quote_first": "It was very cold sitting in the truck and after a while he got out and walked around and flailed at himself with his arms and stamped his boots. Then he got back in the truck. The bar clock said ",
    "quote_time_case": "six-thirty",
    "quote_last": "…By eight-thirty he’d decided that it that was it would take to make the cab arrive then that’s what he would do and he started the engine.",
    "quoteSourceTitle": "Cities of the Plain",
    "quoteAuthor": "Cormac McCarthy",
    "sfw": "yes"
},

"$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-06:30-Baroness Orczy": {
    "title": "$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-06:30-Baroness Orczy",
    "time": "06:30",
    "quote_first": "Nervously she jumped up and listened; the house itself was as still as ever; the footsteps had retreated. Through her wide-open window the brilliant rays of the morning sun were flooding her room with light. She looked up at the clock; it was ",
    "quote_time_case": "half-past six",
    "quote_last": "—too early for any of the household to be already astir.",
    "quoteSourceTitle": "The Scarlet Pimpernel",
    "quoteAuthor": "Baroness Orczy",
    "sfw": "yes"
},

"$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-06:30-Douglas Adams": {
    "title": "$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-06:30-Douglas Adams",
    "time": "06:30",
    "quote_first": "",
    "quote_time_case": "Six-thirty",
    "quote_last": " was clearly a preposterous time and he, the client, obviously hadn’t meant it seriously. A civilised six-thirty for twelve noon was almost certainly what he had in mind, and if he wanted to cut up rough about it, Dirk would have no option but to start handing out some serious statistics. Nobody got murdered before lunch. But nobody. People weren’t up to it. You needed a good lunch to get both the blood-sugar and blood-lust levels up. Dirk had the figures to prove it.",
    "quoteSourceTitle": "The Long Dark Tea-time of the Soul",
    "quoteAuthor": "Douglas Adams",
    "sfw": "yes"
},

"$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-06:30-Gwen Raverat": {
    "title": "$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-06:30-Gwen Raverat",
    "time": "06:30",
    "quote_first": "Sometimes they were hooded carts, sometimes they were just open carts, with planks for seats, on which sat twelve cloaked and bonneted women, six a side, squeezed together, for the interminable journey. As late as 1914 I knew the carrier of Croydon-cum-Clopton, twelve miles from Cambridge; his cart started at ",
    "quote_time_case": "6.30",
    "quote_last": " in the morning and got back at about ten at night. Though he was not old, he could neither read nor write; but he took commissions all along the road - a packet of needles for Mrs. This, and a new teapot for Mrs. That - and delivered them all correctly on the way back.",
    "quoteSourceTitle": "Period Piece",
    "quoteAuthor": "Gwen Raverat",
    "sfw": "yes"
},

"$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-06:32-Dana Chambers": {
    "title": "$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-06:32-Dana Chambers",
    "time": "06:32",
    "quote_first": "The familiar radium numerals on my left wrist confirmed the clock tower. It was ",
    "quote_time_case": "twenty-eight minutes to seven",
    "quote_last": ". I seemed to be filling a set of loud maroon pajamas which were certainly not mine. My vis-a-vis was wearing a little number in yellow.",
    "quoteSourceTitle": "Too Like the Lightning",
    "quoteAuthor": "Dana Chambers",
    "sfw": "yes"
},

"$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-06:33-JG Ballard": {
    "title": "$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-06:33-JG Ballard",
    "time": "06:33",
    "quote_first": "Woke ",
    "quote_time_case": "6.33 a.m.",
    "quote_last": " Last session with Anderson. He made it plain he’s seen enough of me, and from now on I’m better alone. To sleep 8:00? (These count-downs terrify me.) He paused, then added: Goodbye, Eniwetok.",
    "quoteSourceTitle": "The Voices of Time",
    "quoteAuthor": "JG Ballard",
    "sfw": "yes"
},

"$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-06:35-J.S. Fletcher": {
    "title": "$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-06:35-J.S. Fletcher",
    "time": "06:35",
    "quote_first": "My watch lay on the dressing-table close by; glancing at it, I saw that the time was ",
    "quote_time_case": "twenty-five minutes to seven",
    "quote_last": ". I had been told that the family breakfasted at nine, so I had nearly two-and-a-half hours of leisure. Of course, I would go out, and enjoy the freshness of the morning.",
    "quoteSourceTitle": "Ravensdene Court",
    "quoteAuthor": "J.S. Fletcher",
    "sfw": "yes"
},

"$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-06:36-JG Ballard": {
    "title": "$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-06:36-JG Ballard",
    "time": "06:36",
    "quote_first": "Kaldren pursues me like luminescent shadow. He has chalked up on the gateway ‘96,688,365,498,702’. Should confuse the mail man. Woke 9:05. To sleep ",
    "quote_time_case": "6:36",
    "quote_last": ".",
    "quoteSourceTitle": "The Voices of Time",
    "quoteAuthor": "JG Ballard",
    "sfw": "yes"
},

"$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-06:37-Neil Gaiman": {
    "title": "$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-06:37-Neil Gaiman",
    "time": "06:37",
    "quote_first": "The dashboard clock said ",
    "quote_time_case": "6.37am",
    "quote_last": " Town frowned, and checked his wristwatch, which blinked that it was 1.58pm. Great, he thought. I was either up on that tree for eight hours, or for minus a minute.",
    "quoteSourceTitle": "American Gods",
    "quoteAuthor": "Neil Gaiman",
    "sfw": "yes"
},

    "time": "06:38",
    "quote_first": "The clock on the dashboard said it was ",

    "quote_last": " He left the keys in the car, and walked toward the tree.",
    "quoteSourceTitle": "American Gods",

"$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-06:40-Douglas Adams": {
    "title": "$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-06:40-Douglas Adams",
    "time": "06:40",
    "quote_first": "At eleven o'clock the phone rang, and still the figure did not respond, any more than it has responded when the phone had rung at twenty-five to seven in the morning, and again at ",
    "quote_time_case": "twenty to seven",
    "quote_last": "",
    "quoteSourceTitle": "The Long Dark Tea-Time of the Soul",
    "quoteAuthor": "Douglas Adams",
    "sfw": "yes"

    "time": "06:43",
    "quote_first": "To London on the ",
    "quote_time_case": "6.43am.",
    "quote_last": " Jessica is back from her holiday. Things are looking up, she called me Chris, instead of Minister, when we talked on the phone this afternoon.",

    "quote_first": "Simon is happy to travel scum class when he’s on his own and even sometimes deliberately aims for the 6.25. But today the .25 is delayed to ",

    "time": "06:45",
    "quote_first": "As the clock pointed to a ",
    "quote_time_case": "quarter to seven",
    "quote_last": ", the dog woke and shook himself. After waiting in vain for the footman, who was accustomed to let him out, the animal wandered restlessly from one closed door to another on the ground floor; and, returning to his mat in great perplexity, appealed to the sleeping family, with a long and melancholy howl.‘",
    "quoteSourceTitle": "No Name",
    "quoteAuthor": "Wilkie Collins",
    "sfw": "yes"

"$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-06:45-Franz Kafka": {
    "title": "$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-06:45-Franz Kafka",
    "time": "06:45",
    "quote_first": "He was still hurriedly thinking all this through, unable to decide to get out of the bed, when the clock struck ",
    "quote_time_case": "quarter to seven",
    "quote_last": ". There was a cautious knock at the door near his head. “Gregor”, somebody called - it was his mother - “it’s quarter to seven. Didn’t you want to go somewhere?”",
    "quoteSourceTitle": "Metamorphosis",
    "quoteAuthor": "Franz Kafka",
    "sfw": "yes"

"$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-06:46-John Buchan": {
    "title": "$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-06:46-John Buchan",
    "time": "06:46",
    "quote_first": "Then I hung about in the hall waiting for the milkman. That was the worst part of the business, for I was fairly choking to get out of doors. Six-thirty passed, then six-forty, but still he did not come. The fool had chosen this day of all days to be late. At ",
    "quote_time_case": "one minute after the quarter to seven",
    "quote_last": " I heard the rattle of the cans outside. I opened the front door, and there was my man, singling out my cans from a bunch he carried and whistling through his teeth. He jumped a bit at the sight of me.",
    "quoteSourceTitle": "The Thirty-Nine Steps",
    "quoteAuthor": "John Buchan",
    "sfw": "yes"
},

"$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-06:49-Hunter S. Thompson": {

    "time": "06:49",
    "quote_first": "Night ends, ",

    "sfw": "yes"

"$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-06:50-Mary Robison": {

    "quote_first": "Will, my fiancé, was coming from Boston on the ",

    "sfw": "yes"

"$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-07:00-Arthur Koestler": {
    "title": "$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-07:00-Arthur Koestler",
    "time": "07:00",
    "quote_first": "At ",
    "quote_time_case": "seven o’clock",
    "quote_last": " in the morning, Rubashov was awakened by a bugle, but he did not get up. Soon he heard sounds in the corridor. He imagined that someone was to be tortured, and he dreaded hearing the first screams of pain. When the footsteps reached his own section, he saw through the eye hole that guards were serving breakfast. Rubashov did not receive any breakfast because he had reported himself ill. He began to pace up and down the cell, six and a half steps to the window, six and a half steps back.",
    "quoteSourceTitle": "Darkness at Noon",
    "quoteAuthor": "Arthur Koestler",
    "sfw": "yes"
},

"$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-07:00-Charles Dickens": {
    "title": "$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-07:00-Charles Dickens",
    "time": "07:00",
    "quote_first": "I had left directions that I was to be called ",
    "quote_time_case": "at seven",
    "quote_last": "; for it was plain that I must see Wemmick before seeing any one else, and equally plain that this was a case in which his Walworth sentiments, only, could be taken. It was a relief to get out of the room where the night had been so miserable, and I needed no second knocking at the door to startle me from my uneasy bed.",
    "quoteSourceTitle": "Great Expectations",
    "quoteAuthor": "Charles Dickens",
    "sfw": "yes"
},

"$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-07:00-Fyodor Dostoyevsky": {
    "title": "$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-07:00-Fyodor Dostoyevsky",
    "time": "07:00",

    "quoteSourceTitle": "Crime and Punishment",

"$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-07:02-William Gibson": {

"$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-07:03-Hans Hellmut Kirst": {

"$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-07:05-Raymond Carver": {
    "title": "$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-07:05-Raymond Carver",
    "time": "07:05",
    "quote_first": "He really couldn’t believe that the old woman who’d phoned him last night would show up this morning, as she’d said she would. He decided he’d wait until ",
    "quote_time_case": "five minutes after seven o'clock",
    "quote_last": ", and then he’d call in, take the day off, and make every effort in the book to locate someone reliable.",
    "quoteSourceTitle": "Where I'm Calling From",
    "quoteAuthor": "Raymond Carver",
    "sfw": "yes"
},

"$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-07:05-Haruki Murakami": {
    "title": "$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-07:05-Haruki Murakami",
    "time": "07:05",
    "quote_first": "Outside my window the sky hung low and gray. It looked like snow, which added to my malaise. The clock read ",
    "quote_time_case": "five after seven",
    "quote_last": ". I punched the remote control and watched the morning news as I lay in bed.",
    "quoteSourceTitle": "Dance Dance Dance",
    "quoteAuthor": "Haruki Murakami",
    "sfw": "yes"
},

"$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-07:05-Tom Clancy": {
    "title": "$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-07:05-Tom Clancy",
    "time": "07:05",
    "quote_first": "Ryan missed the dawn. He boarded a TWA 747 that left Dulles on time, at ",
    "quote_time_case": "7:05 A.M.",
    "quote_last": " The sky was overcast, and when the aircraft burst through the cloud layer into sunlight, Ryan did something he had never done before. For the first time in his life, Jack Ryan fell asleep on an airplane.",
    "quoteSourceTitle": "The Hunt for Red October",
    "quoteAuthor": "Tom Clancy",
    "sfw": "yes"
},

"$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-07:06-Stephen King": {
    "title": "$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-07:06-Stephen King",
    "time": "07:06",
    "quote_first": "Percy subscribed to that old axiom about how you should get right back on the horse that had thrown you, because here he came through the door at ",
    "quote_time_case": "six minutes past seven",
    "quote_last": ", resplendent in his blue uniform with his sidearm on one hip and his hickory stick in its ridiculous custom-made holster on the other.",
    "quoteSourceTitle": "The Green Mile",
    "quoteAuthor": "Stephen King",
    "sfw": "yes"
},

"$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-07:08-Lee Child": {
    "title": "$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-07:08-Lee Child",
    "time": "07:08",
    "quote_first": "Reacher had no watch but he figured when he saw Gregory it must have been ",
    "quote_time_case": "between eight and nine minutes after seven o'clock",
    "quote_last": ".",
    "quoteSourceTitle": "The Hard Way",
    "quoteAuthor": "Lee Child",
    "sfw": "yes"
},

"$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-07:09-Ray Bradbury": {
    "title": "$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-07:09-Ray Bradbury",
    "time": "07:09",
    "quote_first": "",
    "quote_time_case": "Seven-nine",
    "quote_last": ", breakfast time, seven-nine!",
    "quoteSourceTitle": "There Will Come Soft Rains",
    "quoteAuthor": "Ray Bradbury",
    "sfw": "yes"
},

"$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-07:10-John Buchan": {
    "title": "$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-07:10-John Buchan",
    "time": "07:10",
    "quote_first": "A search in Bradshaw informed me that a train left St Pancras at ",
    "quote_time_case": "7.10",
    "quote_last": ", which would land me at any Galloway station in the late afternoon.",
    "quoteSourceTitle": "The Thirty-Nine Steps",
    "quoteAuthor": "John Buchan",
    "sfw": "yes"
},

"$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-07:10-Mini Nair": {
    "title": "$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-07:10-Mini Nair",
    "time": "07:10",
    "quote_first": "There were many others waiting to execute the same operation, so she would have to move fast, elbow her way to the front so that she emerged first. The time was ",
    "quote_time_case": "7:10",
    "quote_last": " in the morning. The manoeuvre would start at 7:12. She looked apprehensively at the giant clock at the railway station.",
    "quoteSourceTitle": "The Fourth Passenger",
    "quoteAuthor": "Mini Nair",
    "sfw": "yes"
},

"$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-07:12-Steve Toltz": {
    "title": "$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-07:12-Steve Toltz",
    "time": "07:12",
    "quote_first": "He taught me that if I had to meet someone for an appointment, I must refuse to follow the ‘stupid human habit’ of arbitrarily choosing a time based on fifteen-minute intervals. ‘Never meet people at 7:45 or 6:30, Jasper, but pick times like ",
    "quote_time_case": "7:12",
    "quote_last": " and 8:03!'",
    "quoteSourceTitle": "A Fraction of the Whole",
    "quoteAuthor": "Steve Toltz",
    "sfw": "yes"
},

"$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-07:13-WG Sebald": {
    "title": "$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-07:13-WG Sebald",
    "time": "07:13",
    "quote_first": "It was all the more surprising and indeed alarming a little later, said Austerlitz, when I looked out of the corridor window of my carriage just before the train left at ",
    "quote_time_case": "seven-thirteen",
    "quote_last": ", to find it dawning upon me with perfect certainty that I had seen the pattern of glass and steel roof above the platforms before.",
    "quoteSourceTitle": "Austerlitz",
    "quoteAuthor": "WG Sebald",
    "sfw": "yes"
},

"$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-07:14-Jo Nesbo": {
    "title": "$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-07:14-Jo Nesbo",
    "time": "07:14",
    "quote_first": "At ",
    "quote_time_case": "7.14",
    "quote_last": " Harry knew he was alive. He knew that because the pain could be felt in every nerve fibre.",
    "quoteSourceTitle": "The Redeemer",
    "quoteAuthor": "Jo Nesbo",
    "sfw": "yes"
},

"$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-07:15-H.P. Lovecraft": {
    "title": "$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-07:15-H.P. Lovecraft",

"$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-08:00-P.G. Wodehouse": {
    "title": "$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-08:00-P.G. Wodehouse",
    "time": "08:00",
    "quote_first": "Through the curtained windows of the furnished apartment which Mrs. Horace Hignett had rented for her stay in New York rays of golden sunlight peeped in like the foremost spies of some advancing army. It was a fine summer morning. The hands of the Dutch clock in the hall pointed to thirteen minutes past nine; those of the ormolu clock in the sitting-room to eleven minutes past ten; those of the carriage clock on the bookshelf to fourteen minutes to six. In other words, it was ",
    "quote_time_case": "exactly eight",
    "quote_last": "; and Mrs. Hignett acknowledged the fact by moving her head on the pillow, opening her eyes, and sitting up in bed. She always woke at eight precisely.",
    "quoteSourceTitle": "Three Men and a Maid",

"$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-08:00-Thomas Mann": {
    "title": "$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-08:00-Thomas Mann",
    "time": "08:00",
    "quote_first": "When he opened the windows in the morning, the sky was as overcast as it had been, but the air seemed fresher, and regret set in. Had giving notice not been impetuous and wrongheaded, the result of an inconsequential indisposition? If he had held off a bit, if he had not been so quick to lose heart, if he had instead tried to adjust to the air or wait for the weather to improve, he would now have been free of stress and strain and looking forward to a morning on the beach like the one the day before. Too late. He must go on wanting what he had wanted yesterday. He dressed and rode down to the ground floor ",
    "quote_time_case": "at eight",
    "quote_last": " for breakfast.",
    "quoteSourceTitle": "Death in Venice",
    "quoteAuthor": "Thomas Mann",
    "sfw": "yes"
},

    "quote_first": "‘Care for a turn on the engine?’ he called to the doxies, and pointed up at the footplate. They laughed but voted not to, climbing up with their bathtub into one of the rattlers instead. They both had very fetching hats, with one flower apiece, but the prettiness of their faces made you think it was more. For some reason they both wore white rosettes pinned to their dresses. I looked again at the clock: ",
