"$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-08:15-Jerome K Jerome": {
    "title": "$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-08:15-Jerome K Jerome",
    "time": "08:15",
    "quote_first": "It was in the winter when this happened, very near the shortest day, and a week of fog into the bargain, so the fact that it was still very dark when George woke in the morning was no guide to him as to the time. He reached up, and hauled down his watch. It was a ",
    "quote_time_case": "quarter-past eight",
    "quote_last": ".",
    "quoteSourceTitle": "Three Men in a Boat",
    "quoteAuthor": "Jerome K Jerome",
    "sfw": "yes"
},

    "time": "08:15",
    "quote_first": "You scrutinized your wrist: “It’s ",
    "quote_time_case": "eight fifteen",
    "quote_last": ". (And here time forked.) I’ll turn it on.” The screen In its blank broth evolved a lifelike blur, And music welled.",
    "quoteSourceTitle": "Pale Fire",

    "sfw": "yes"
},

"$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-08:16-Sophie Kinsella": {
    "title": "$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-08:16-Sophie Kinsella",
    "time": "08:16",
    "quote_first": "I walk through the fruit trees toward a huge, square, brown patch of earth with vegetation growing in serried rows. These must be the vegetables. I prod one of them cautiously with my foot. It could be a cabbage or a lettuce. Or the leaves of something growing underground, maybe. To be honest, it could be an alien. I have no idea. I sit down on a mossy wooden bench and look at a nearby bush covered in white flowers. Mm. Pretty. Now what? What do people do in their gardens? I feel I should have something to read. Or someone to call. My fingers are itching to move. I look at my watch. Still only ",
    "quote_time_case": "eight sixteen",
    "quote_last": ". Oh God.",
    "quoteSourceTitle": "The Undomestic Goddess",
    "quoteAuthor": "Sophie Kinsella",
    "sfw": "yes"
},

"$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-08:17-Jules Verne": {
    "title": "$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-08:17-Jules Verne",
    "time": "08:17",
    "quote_first": "Breakfast over, my uncle drew from his pocket a small notebook, intended for scientific observations. He consulted his instruments, and recorded:\n“Monday, July 1.\n“Chronometer, ",
    "quote_time_case": "8.17 a.m.",
    "quote_last": "; barometer, 297 in.; thermometer, 6° (43° F.). Direction, E.S.E.”\nThis last observation applied to the dark gallery, and was indicated by the compass.",
    "quoteSourceTitle": "A Journey to the Centre of the Earth",
    "quoteAuthor": "Jules Verne",
    "sfw": "yes"
},

"$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-08:17-Sophie Kinsella": {
    "title": "$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-08:17-Sophie Kinsella",
    "time": "08:17",
    "quote_first": "Come on, I can’t give up yet. I’ll just sit here for a bit and enjoy the peace. I lean back and watch a little speckled bird pecking the ground nearby for a while. Then I look at my watch again: ",
    "quote_time_case": "eight seventeen",
    "quote_last": ". I can’t do this.",
    "quoteSourceTitle": "The Undomestic Goddess",
    "quoteAuthor": "Sophie Kinsella",
    "sfw": "yes"
},

    "quote_first": "It was around ",
    "quote_time_case": "nine o'clock",
    "quote_last": " that I crossed the border into Cornwall. This was at least three hours before the rain began and the clouds were still all of a brilliant white. It was unfortunate, then, that I could not for much of the time give to them the attention they warranted; for one may as well declare it, one was in a condition of some preoccupation with the thought that - barring some unseen complication - one would be meeting Miss Kenton again before the day’s end.",
    "quoteSourceTitle": "The Remains of the Day",
    "quoteAuthor": "Kazuo Ishiguro",
    "sfw": "yes"
},

"$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-09:00-Thomas Mann": {
    "title": "$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-09:00-Thomas Mann",
    "time": "09:00",
    "quote_first": "Opening his window, Aschenbach thought he could smell the foul stench of the lagoon. A sudden despondency came over him. He considered leaving then and there. Once, years before, after weeks of a beautiful spring, he had been visited by this sort of weather and it so affected his health he had been obliged to flee. Was not the same listless fever setting in? The pressure in the temples, the heavy eyelids? Changing hotels again would be a nuisance, but if the wind failed to shift he could not possibly remain here. To be on the safe side, he did not unpack everything. ",
    "quote_time_case": "At nine",
    "quote_last": " he went to breakfast in the specially designated buffet between the lobby and the dining room.",
    "quoteSourceTitle": "Death in Venice",
    "quoteAuthor": "Thomas Mann",
    "sfw": "yes"
},

    "time": "09:28",
    "quote_first": "He entered No. 10 for the first time, he who had sat on the Government benches for eight years and who had known the Prime Minister from youth up. “This clock right?” he asked the butler in the hall. “Yes, sir.” The clock showed ",

    "sfw": "yes"

"$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-09:30-Richard Yates": {

    "time": "09:30",
    "quote_first": "It was ",
    "quote_time_case": "nine-thirty",
    "quote_last": ". In another ten minutes she would turn off the heat; then it would take a while for the water to cool. In the meantime there was nothing to do but wait. “Have you thought it through April?” Never undertake to do a thing until you’ve –“ But she needed no more advice and no more instruction. She was calm and quiet now with knowing what she had always known, what neither her parents not Aunt Claire not Frank nor anyone else had ever had to teach her: that if you wanted to do something absolutely honest, something true, it always turned out to be a thing that had to be done alone.",
    "quoteSourceTitle": "Revolutionary Road",
    "quoteAuthor": "Richard Yates",
    "sfw": "yes"
},

    "sfw": "yes"

    "time": "09:53",
    "quote_first": "Miss Pettigrew went to the bus-stop to await a bus. She could not afford the fare, but she could still less afford to lose a possible situation by being late. The bus deposited her about five minutes' walk from Onslow Mansions, an at ",

},

    "time": "09:54",
    "quote_first": "",
    "quote_time_case": "9:54",
    "quote_last": " This is sheer torture. My arms have never ached so much in my entire life. The blankets weigh a ton, and the sheets won’t go straight and I have no idea how to do the wretched corners. How do chambermaids do it?",
    "quoteSourceTitle": "The Undomestic Goddess",
    "quoteAuthor": "Sophie Kinsella",
    "sfw": "yes"
},

"$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-09:55-Sophie Kinsella": {

    "time": "09:55",
    "quote_first": "At ",
    "quote_time_case": "five to ten",
    "quote_last": " I’m ready in the hall. Nathaniel’s mother’s house is nearby but apparently tricky to find, so the plan is to meet here and he’ll walk me over. I check my reflection in the hall mirror and wince. The streak of bleach in my hair is as obvious as ever. Am I really going out in public like this?",
    "quoteSourceTitle": "The Undomestic Goddess",
    "quoteAuthor": "Sophie Kinsella",
    "sfw": "yes"
},

"$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-09:55-Alexandre Dumas": {
    "title": "$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-09:55-Alexandre Dumas",
    "time": "09:55",
    "quote_first": "Good-morning, Lucien, good-morning, said Albert; “your punctuality really alarms me. What do I say? punctuality! You, whom I expected last, you arrive at ",

    "title": "$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-10:00-Virginia Woolf",
    "time": "10:00",
    "quote_first": "For some seconds the light went on becoming brighter and brighter, and she saw everything more and more clearly and the clock ticked louder and louder until there was a terrific explosion right in her ear. Orlando leapt as if she had been violently struck on the head. ",

    "quote_first": "Through the curtained windows of the furnished apartment which Mrs. Horace Hignett had rented for her stay in New York rays of golden sunlight peeped in like the foremost spies of some advancing army.     "quote_first": "The date was the 14th of May and the clock on his desk said the time was ",
    "quote_time_case": "twenty three minutes past ten",
    "quote_last": ", so he tapped in the numbers 10.23. At least, that’s what he meant to do. In fact he typed in the numbers 10.03",
    "quoteSourceTitle": "Ctrl-Z",
    "quoteAuthor": "Andrew Norriss",
    "sfw": "yes"
},

"$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-10:25-Heinrich B\u00F6ll": {

    "time": "10:25",
    "quote_first": "",
    "quote_time_case": "10:25",

    "sfw": "yes"

"$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-10:25-JG Ballard": {
    "title": "$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-10:25-JG Ballard",
    "time": "10:25",
    "quote_first": "One meal is enough now, topped up with a glucose shot. Sleep is still ‘black’, completely unrefreshing. Last night I took a 16 mm. film of the first three hours, screened it this morning at the lab. The first true-horror movie. I looked like a half-animated corpse. Woke ",
    "quote_time_case": "10:25",
    "quote_last": ". To sleep 3:45.",
    "quoteSourceTitle": "The Voices of Time",
    "quoteAuthor": "JG Ballard",
    "sfw": "yes"
},

"$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-10:26-Sophie Kinsella": {
    "title": "$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-10:26-Sophie Kinsella",
    "time": "10:26",
    "quote_first": "",
    "quote_time_case": "10:26",
    "quote_last": " No. Please, no. I can hardly bear to look. It’s a total disaster. Everything in the washing machine has gone pink. Every single thing. What happened? With trembling fingers I pick out a damp cashmere cardigan. It was a cream when I put it in. It’s now a sickly shade of candy floss. I knew K3 was bad news. I knew it -",
    "quoteSourceTitle": "The Undomestic Goddess",
    "quoteAuthor": "Sophie Kinsella",
    "sfw": "yes"
},

"$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-10:26-Haruki Murakami": {
    "title": "$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-10:26-Haruki Murakami",
    "time": "10:26",
    "quote_first": "In the exact centre of my visual field was the alarm clock, hands pointing to ",
    "quote_time_case": "ten-twenty-six",
    "quote_last": ". An alarm clock I received as a memento of somebody’s wedding.",
    "quoteSourceTitle": "Hard-boiled Wonderland and The End of the World",
    "quoteAuthor": "Haruki Murakami",
    "sfw": "yes"
},

"$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-10:27-AG Macdonell": {
    "title": "$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-10:27-AG Macdonell",
    "time": "10:27",
    "quote_first": "Mr. Harcourt woke up with mysterious suddenness at ",
    "quote_time_case": "twenty-seven minutes past 10",
    "quote_last": ", and, by a curious coincidence, it was at that very instant that the butler came in with two footmen laden with trays of whisky, brandy, syphons, glasses, and biscuits.",
    "quoteSourceTitle": "England, Their England",
    "quoteAuthor": "AG Macdonell",
    "sfw": "yes"
},

"$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-10:27-Ali Smith": {
    "title": "$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-10:27-Ali Smith",
    "time": "10:27",
    "quote_first": "She is on holiday in Norfolk. The substandard clock radio says ",
    "quote_time_case": "10:27 a.m.",
    "quote_last": " The noise is Katrina the Cleaner thumping the hoover against the skirting boards and the bedroom doors. Her hand is asleep. It is still hooked through the handstrap of the camera. She unhooks it and shakes it to get the blood back into it. She puts her feet on top of her trainers and slides them across the substandard carpet. It has the bare naked feet of who knows how many hundreds of dead or old people on it.",
    "quoteSourceTitle": "The Accidental",
    "quoteAuthor": "Ali Smith",
    "sfw": "yes"
},

"$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-10:37-Dorothy L. Sayers": {
    "title": "$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-10:37-Dorothy L. Sayers",

},

"$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-10:38-Sophie Kinsella": {
    "title": "$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-10:38-Sophie Kinsella",
    "time": "10:38",
    "quote_first": "There must be a solution, there must be. Frantically I scan the cans of products stacked on the shelves. Stain Away. Vanish. There has to be a remedy. … I just need to think. … ",
    "quote_time_case": "10:38",
    "quote_last": " OK, I have the answer. It may not totally work—but it’s my best shot.",

    "quoteAuthor": "Sophie Kinsella",
    "sfw": "yes"
},

"$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-10:45-Arthur Conan Doyle": {
    "title": "$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-10:45-Arthur Conan Doyle",
    "time": "10:45",
    "quote_first": "If this is so, we have now to determine what Barker and Mrs. Douglas, presuming they are not the actual murderers, would have been doing from ",

    "quoteSourceTitle": "The Valley of Fear",
    "quoteAuthor": "Arthur Conan Doyle",
    "sfw": "yes"
},

    "quoteAuthor": "J.K.Rowling",
    "sfw": "yes"
},

"$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-10:48-Louise Doughty": {

    "time": "10:48",

    "quote_time_case": "10.48am",

    "quoteSourceTitle": "Apple Tree Yard",

},

"$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-10:49-F\u00E9licien de Saulcy": {

"$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-10:50-Len Deighton": {

    "quote_first": "As he walked back to the flight office, airmen were forming a line to await the arrival of the NAAFI van with morning tea and cakes. Lambert looked at his watch; it was ",

"$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-10:53-Michael Frayn": {

    "quote_first": "He begins to make a record of our observations.‘",
    "quote_time_case": "10.53 hrs",

    "quoteSourceTitle": "Spies",

    "sfw": "yes"
},

"$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-10:53-W.G. Sebald": {
    "title": "$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-10:53-W.G. Sebald",
    "time": "10:53",
    "quote_first": "I gaze and gaze again at that face, which seems to me both strange and familiar, said Austerlitz, I run the tape back repeatedly, looking at the time indicator in the top left-hand corner of the screen, where the figures covering part of her forehead show the minutes and seconds, from ",
    "quote_time_case": "10:53",
    "quote_last": " to 10:57, while the hundredths of a second flash by so fast that you cannot read and capture them.",
    "quoteSourceTitle": "Austerlitz",
    "quoteAuthor": "W.G. Sebald",
    "sfw": "yes"
},

"$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-10:55-AA Milne": {
    "title": "$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-10:55-AA Milne",

    "quote_time_case": "five minutes to eleven",

    "quoteSourceTitle": "The House at Pooh Corner",
    "quoteAuthor": "AA Milne",
    "sfw": "yes"

"$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-10:57-W. G. Sebald": {
    "title": "$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-10:57-W. G. Sebald",
    "time": "10:57",
    "quote_first": "I run the tape back repeatedly, looking at the time indicator in the top left-hand corner of the screen, where the figures covering part of her forehead show the minutes and seconds, from 10.53 to ",
    "quote_time_case": "10.57",
    "quote_last": ".",
    "quoteSourceTitle": "Austerlitz",
    "quoteAuthor": "W. G. Sebald",
    "sfw": "yes"
},

"$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-10:58-Helen DeWitt": {
    "title": "$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-10:58-Helen DeWitt",
    "time": "10:58",
    "quote_first": "One day Joe was sitting in the office waiting for his 11 o'clock appointment, and at ",
    "quote_time_case": "10:58",
    "quote_last": " this black gal came in.",
    "quoteSourceTitle": "Lightning Rods",
    "quoteAuthor": "Helen DeWitt",
    "sfw": "yes"
},

"$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-10:59-J. K. Rowling": {
    "title": "$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-10:59-J. K. Rowling",
    "time": "10:59",
    "quote_first": "Harry grunted in his sleep and his face slid down the window an inch or so, making his glasses still more lopsided, but he did not wake up. An alarm clock, repaired by Harry several years ago, ticked loudly on the sill, showing ",
    "quote_time_case": "one minute to eleven",
    "quote_last": ".",
    "quoteSourceTitle": "Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince",
    "quoteAuthor": "J. K. Rowling",
    "sfw": "yes"
},

"$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-11:00-Virginia Woolf": {
    "title": "$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-11:00-Virginia Woolf",
    "time": "11:00",
    "quote_first": "Big Ben was striking as she stepped out into the street. It was ",
    "quote_time_case": "eleven o'clock",
    "quote_last": " and the unused hour was fresh as if issued to children on a beach.",
    "quoteSourceTitle": "Mrs Dalloway",
    "quoteAuthor": "Virginia Woolf",
    "sfw": "yes"
},

"$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-11:00-Scarlett Thomas": {
    "title": "$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-11:00-Scarlett Thomas",
    "time": "11:00",
    "quote_first": "“By ",
    "quote_time_case": "11 o'clock",
    "quote_last": " I have finished the first chapter of Mr Y. The winter sun is peeping meekly through the thin curtains and I decide to get up"",
    "quoteSourceTitle": "The End of Mr Y",
    "quoteAuthor": "Scarlett Thomas",
    "sfw": "yes"
},

"$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-11:00-Rosamond Lehmann": {
    "title": "$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-11:00-Rosamond Lehmann",
    "time": "11:00",
    "quote_first": "He was rather a long time, and I began to feel muffled, weighed down by thick stuffs and silence. I thought: He’ll never come back; and when he did his figure seemed to come at me from very far away, dream-like and dwindled, making his way back along a tunnel…I dare say it was champagne ",
    "quote_time_case": "at eleven",
    "quote_last": " in the morning.",
    "quoteSourceTitle": "The Weather in the Streets",
    "quoteAuthor": "Rosamond Lehmann",
    "sfw": "yes"
},

"$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-11:00-Evelyn Waugh": {
    "title": "$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-11:00-Evelyn Waugh",
    "time": "11:00",
    "quote_first": "As her husband had told him, she was still in bed although it was past ",
    "quote_time_case": "11 o'clock",
    "quote_last": ". Her normally mobile face was encased in clay, rigid and menacing as an Aztec mask.",
    "quoteSourceTitle": "Scoop",
    "quoteAuthor": "Evelyn Waugh",
    "sfw": "yes"
},

"$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-11:00-Jo Nesbo": {
    "title": "$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-11:00-Jo Nesbo",
    "time": "11:00",
    "quote_first": "At ",
    "quote_time_case": "eleven o'clock",
    "quote_last": " in the morning, large flakes had appeared from a colourless sky and invaded the fields, gardens and lawns of Romerike like an armada from outer space.",
    "quoteSourceTitle": "The Snowman",
    "quoteAuthor": "Jo Nesbo",
    "sfw": "yes"
},

"$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-11:00-Douglas Adams": {
    "title": "$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-11:00-Douglas Adams",
    "time": "11:00",
    "quote_first": "At ",
    "quote_time_case": "eleven o'clock",
    "quote_last": " the phone rang, and still the figure did not respond, any more than it had responded when the phone had rung at twenty-five to seven, and again for ten minutes continuously starting at five to seven…",
    "quoteSourceTitle": "The Long Dark Tea-Time of the Soul",
    "quoteAuthor": "Douglas Adams",
    "sfw": "yes"
},

"$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-11:00-Raymond Chandler": {
    "title": "$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-11:00-Raymond Chandler",
    "time": "11:00",
    "quote_first": "It was about ",
    "quote_time_case": "eleven o'clock",
    "quote_last": " in the morning, mid October, with the sun not shining and a look of hard wet rain in the clearness of the foothills. I was wearing my powder-blue suit, with dark blue shirt, tie and display handkerchief, black brogues, black wool socks with dark blue clocks on them. I was neat, clean, shaved and sober, and I didn’t care who knew it. I was everything the well-dressed private detective ought to be. I was calling on four millon dollars.",
    "quoteSourceTitle": "The big sleep",
    "quoteAuthor": "Raymond Chandler",
    "sfw": "yes"
},

"$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-11:00-Patsy Hickman": {
    "title": "$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-11:00-Patsy Hickman",
    "time": "11:00",
    "quote_first": "My sister is terrified that I might write and tell all the family secrets. Why do I feel like a rebel, like an iconoclast? I am only trying to do a writing class, what is wrong with that? I keep telling myself that once in the car I will be fine, I can listen to Radio Four Woman’s Hour and that will take me till ",
    "quote_time_case": "eleven",
    "quote_last": " o’clock when the class starts.",
    "quoteSourceTitle": "The Saints",
    "quoteAuthor": "Patsy Hickman",
    "sfw": "yes"
},

"$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-11:00-G.W.M. Reynolds": {
    "title": "$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-11:00-G.W.M. Reynolds",
    "time": "11:00",
    "quote_first": "ON the morning following the events just narrated, Mrs. Arlington was seated at breakfast in a sweet little parlour of the splendid mansion which the Earl of Warrington had taken and fitted up for her in Dover Street, Piccadilly. It was about ",
    "quote_time_case": "eleven o'clock",
    "quote_last": "; and the Enchantress was attired in a delicious deshabillé. With her little feet upon an ottoman near the fender, and her fine form reclining in a luxurious large arm-chair, she divided her attention between her chocolate and the columns of the Morning Herald. She invariably prolonged the morning’s repast as much as possible, limply because it served to wile away the time until the hour for dressing arrived.",
    "quoteSourceTitle": "The Mysteries of London",
    "quoteAuthor": "G.W.M. Reynolds",
    "sfw": "yes"
},

"$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-11:00-George Augustus Sala": {
    "title": "$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-11:00-George Augustus Sala",
    "time": "11:00",
    "quote_first": "Quiet as I am, I become at ",
    "quote_time_case": "Eleven o'Clock",
    "quote_last": " in the Morning on every day of the week save Sunday a raving, ranting maniac – a dangerous lunatic, panting with insane desires to do, not only myself but other people, a mischief, and possessed less by hallucination than by rabies.",
    "quoteSourceTitle": "Twice Around the Clock",
    "quoteAuthor": "George Augustus Sala",
    "sfw": "yes"
},

"$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-11:00-Alan Hollinghurst": {
    "title": "$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-11:00-Alan Hollinghurst",
    "time": "11:00",
    "quote_first": "Though perhaps' – but here the bracket clock whirred and then hectically struck ",
    "quote_time_case": "eleven",
    "quote_last": ", its weights spooling downwards at the sudden expense of energy. She had to sit for a moment, when the echo had vanished, to repossess her thoughts.",
    "quoteSourceTitle": "The Stranger's Child",
    "quoteAuthor": "Alan Hollinghurst",
    "sfw": "yes"
},

"$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-11:00-Jerome K Jerome": {
    "title": "$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-11:00-Jerome K Jerome",
    "time": "11:00",
    "quote_first": "We got to Waterloo ",
    "quote_time_case": "at eleven",
    "quote_last": ", and asked where the eleven-five started from.Of course nobody knew; nobody at Waterloo ever does know where a train is going to start from, or where a train when it does start is going to, or anything about it.",
    "quoteSourceTitle": "Three Men in a Boat",
    "quoteAuthor": "Jerome K Jerome",

"$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-11:00-Mary Shelley": {
    "title": "$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-11:00-Mary Shelley",
    "time": "11:00",
    "quote_first": "We passed a few sad hours until ",
    "quote_time_case": "eleven o'clock",
    "quote_last": ", when the trial was to commence. My father and the rest of the family being obliged to attend as witnesses, I accompanied them to the court. During the whole of this wretched mockery of justice I suffered living torture.",
    "quoteSourceTitle": "Frankenstein",
    "quoteAuthor": "Mary Shelley",
    "sfw": "yes"
},

"$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-11:01-Justin Cronin": {
    "title": "$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-11:01-Justin Cronin",
    "time": "11:01",
    "quote_first": "O'Neil rises and takes the tray. He has finished the tea, but the muffins are still here in a wicker basket covered with a blue napkin. The clock above the stove says that it is ",
    "quote_time_case": "just past eleven",
    "quote_last": ", and guests will be arriving at the house now.",
    "quoteSourceTitle": "Mary and O'Neil",
    "quoteAuthor": "Justin Cronin",
    "sfw": "yes"
},

    "title": "$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-11:02-The Manhattan Engineer District",
    "time": "11:02",
    "quote_first": "On August 9th, three days later, at ",
    "quote_time_case": "11.02am",
    "quote_last": ", another B−29 dropped the second bomb on the industrial section of the city of Nagasaki, totally destroying 1 ½ square miles of the city, killing 39,000 persons and injuring 25,000 more.",
    "quoteSourceTitle": "The Atomic Bombings of Hiroshima and Nagasaki",
    "quoteAuthor": "The Manhattan Engineer District",
    "sfw": "yes"
},

"$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-11:03-Christopher Buckley": {
    "title": "$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-11:03-Christopher Buckley",
    "time": "11:03",
    "quote_first": "“What makes you think it’s for real?” “Just a hunch, really. He sounded for real. Sometimes you can just tell about people”-he smiled-“even if you’re a dull old WASP.” “I think it’s a setup.” “Why?” “I just do. Why would someone from the government want to help you?” “Good question. Guess I’ll find out.” She went back into the kitchen.“What time are you meeting him?” she called out. “",
    "quote_time_case": "Eleven oh-three",
    "quote_last": ",” he said. “That made me think he’s for real. Military and intelligence types set precise appointment times to eliminate confusion and ambiguity. Nothing ambiguous about eleven oh-three."",
    "quoteSourceTitle": "Little Green Men",
    "quoteAuthor": "Christopher Buckley",
    "sfw": "yes"
},

    "quote_first": "On the fourth, at ",
    "quote_time_case": "11.03am",

    "time": "11:05",
    "quote_first": "July 3: 5 ¾ hours. Little done today. Deepening lethargy, dragged myself over to the lab, nearly left the road twice. Concentrated enough to feed the zoo and get the log up to date. Read through the operating manuals Whitby left for the last time, decided on a delivery rate of 40 rontgens/min., target distance of 530 cm. Everything is ready now. Woke ",

    "quote_first": "Sansom arrived in a Town Car at ",

Murchison worked at Simpson Redwood, and Gene Grant was a cook on the morning shift at Denny’s. Those two, then a vacant lot, then the house on the end that used to belong to the Coles.",

The baron tried the edge of the blade with his finger, and asked the dreadful swordsman if his hand was sure? A nod was the reply of the man of blood.     "quote_time_case": "twelve",
    "quote_last": " of the clock. “Now they are all on their knees,” An elder said as we sat in a flock By the embers in hearthside ease. We pictured the meek mild creatures where They dwelt in their strawy pen, Nor did it occur to one of us there To doubt they were kneeling then. So fair a fancy few would weave In these years! Yet, I feel, If someone said on Christmas Eve, “Come; see the oxen kneel "In the lonely barton by yonder coomb Our childhood used to know,” I should go with him in the gloom, Hoping it might be so.",

    "time": "12:00",
    "quote_first": "Then came the stroke of ",
    "quote_time_case": "noon",
    "quote_last": ", and all these working and professional people dispersed like a trampled anthill into all the streets and directions. The white bridge was swarming with nimble dots. And when you considered that each dot had a mouth with which it was now planning to eat lunch, you couldn’t help bursting into laughter.",
    "quoteSourceTitle": "The Tanners",

"$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-12:01-J.G. Ballard": {
    "title": "$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-12:01-J.G. Ballard",
    "time": "12:01",
    "quote_first": "And on all sides there were the clocks. Conrad noticed them immediately, at every street corner, over every archway, three quarters of the way up the sides of buildings, covering every conceivable angle of approach. Most of them were too high off the ground to be reached by anything less than a fireman’s ladder and still retained their hands. All registered the same time: ",
    "quote_time_case": "12:01",
    "quote_last": ". Conrad looked at his wristwatch, noted that it was just 2:45. ‘‘They were driven by a master dock’’ Stacey told him. ‘‘When that stopped, they all ceased at the same moment. One minute after midnight, thirty-seven years ago.’’",
    "quoteSourceTitle": "Chronopolis",
    "quoteAuthor": "J.G. Ballard",
    "sfw": "yes"
},

"$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-12:01-Jonathan Trigell": {

    "time": "12:01",
    "quote_first": "It was the twelfth of December, the twelfth month. A was twelve. The electric clock/radio by his bedside table said ",
    "quote_time_case": "12:01",

    "quoteSourceTitle": "Boy A",

    "sfw": "yes"

    "quote_first": "It had struck ",
    "quote_time_case": "twelve o'clock two minutes and a quarter",
    "quote_last": ". The Baron’s footman hastily seized a large goblet, and gasped with terror as he filled it with hot, spiced wine. “Tis past the hour, ‘tis past,” he groaned in anguish, “and surely I shall now get the red hot poker the Baron hath so often promised me, oh! Woe is me! Would that I had prepared the Baron’s lunch before!”",
    "quoteSourceTitle": "Crundle Castle",
    "quoteAuthor": "Lewis Carroll",
    "sfw": "yes"

    "quote_time_case": "12.04pm",

"$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-12:11-Jonathan Trigell": {
    "title": "$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-12:11-Jonathan Trigell",
    "time": "12:11",
    "quote_first": "At ",
    "quote_time_case": "12:11",
    "quote_last": " there was a knock on the door. It was Terry, A could tell. He hadn’t known Terry long, but there was something calmer, more patient, that separated Terry’s knocks from the rest of the staff. He knocked from genuine politeness, not formality. “Come in,” A said, although the lock was on the other side. Terry did. “It’s your mother,” he said. “There’s no easy way to say this.” Though he had just used the easiest, because A now knew the rest. A’s face froze, as it tried to catch up, as it tried to register the news. Then it crumpled, and while he considered this fresh blow, the tears came.",
    "quoteSourceTitle": "Boy A",
    "quoteAuthor": "Jonathan Trigell",
    "sfw": "yes"
},

"$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-12:12-Jonathan Trigell": {

"$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-13:00-Sybille Bedford": {
    "title": "$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-13:00-Sybille Bedford",
    "time": "13:00",
    "quote_first": "I got to Schmidt’s early, feeling horribly nervous. At ",
    "quote_time_case": "one o'clock",
    "quote_last": " sharp: Toni. She was looking at the menu she knew well - Schmorbraten? Schnitzel? - when he loomed over her. I had seen him come in. She looked up, through him, at me. ‘Traitor.’ Jamie, hovering, looking very big, said her pet name, a German diminutive chosen by her. Toni addressed the air. ‘If he does not leave at once I shall tell the waiter that I am not sharing my table with this gentleman.’ Jamie heard, said her name again, turned to go, I rose to go with him. Toni - with that concentration of will - said, ‘YOU are lunching with me.'",
    "quoteSourceTitle": "Jigsaw",
    "quoteAuthor": "Sybille Bedford",
    "sfw": "yes"
},

"$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-13:30-Virginia Woolf": {

    "time": "13:30",
    "quote_first": "Shredding and slicing, dividing and subdividing, the clocks of Harley Street nibbled at the June day, counselled submission, upheld authority, and pointed out in chorus the supreme advantages of a sense of proportion, until the mound of time was so far diminished that a commercial clock, suspended above a shop in Oxford Street, announced, genially and fraternally, as if it were a pleasure to Messrs Rigby and Lowndes to give the information gratis, that it was ",

    "sfw": "yes"
},

    "quote_first": "Inevitable, implacable, the rainstorm wept itself out. She saw Tom look at his watch. ‘What time is it?’ ‘",

    "time": "14:30",
    "quote_first": "It was ",
    "quote_time_case": "half-past two",
    "quote_last": " in the afternoon. The sun hung in the faded blue sky like a burning mirror, and away beyond the paddocks the blue mountains quivered and leapt like sea. Sid wouldn’t be back until half-past ten. He had ridden over to the township with four of the boys to help hunt down the young fellow who’d murdered Mr. Williamson. Such a dreadful thing!",
    "quoteSourceTitle": "Millie",
    "quoteAuthor": "Katherine Mansfield",
    "sfw": "yes"
},

"$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-14:30-Bram Stoker": {
    "title": "$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-14:30-Bram Stoker",
    "time": "14:30",
    "quote_first": "It was ",
    "quote_time_case": "half-past two",
    "quote_last": " o'clock when the knock came. I took my courage a deux mains and waited. In a few minutes Mary opened the door, and announced “Dr. Van Helsing”.",
    "quoteSourceTitle": "Dracula",
    "quoteAuthor": "Bram Stoker",
    "sfw": "yes"
},

"$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-14:30-Dorothy Wordsworth": {
    "title": "$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-14:30-Dorothy Wordsworth",
    "time": "14:30",
    "quote_first": "May 14th 1800. Wm and John set off into Yorkshire after dinner at ",
    "quote_time_case": "½ past 2 o'clock",
    "quote_last": ", cold pork in their pockets. I left them at the turning of the Low-wood bay under the trees. My heart was so full that I could barely speak to W. when I gave him a farewell kiss.",
    "quoteSourceTitle": "The Journals of Dorothy Wordsworth",
    "quoteAuthor": "Dorothy Wordsworth",
    "sfw": "yes"
},

"$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-14:32-Charles Bukowski": {
    "title": "$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-14:32-Charles Bukowski",
    "time": "14:32",
    "quote_first": "Like ",
    "quote_time_case": "2.32 p.m.",
    "quote_last": ", Beecher and Avalon, L3 R2 (which meant left three blocks, right two) 2:35 p.m., and you wondered how you could pick up one box, then drive 5 blocks in 3 minutes and be finished cleaning out another box.",
    "quoteSourceTitle": "Post Office",
    "quoteAuthor": "Charles Bukowski",
    "sfw": "yes"
},

"$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-14:36-Haruki Murakami": {

    "quoteSourceTitle": "The Elephant Vanishes",
    "quoteAuthor": "Haruki Murakami",
    "sfw": "yes"
},

"$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-14:40-J.D. Salinger": {
    "title": "$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-14:40-J.D. Salinger",
    "time": "14:40",
    "quote_first": "If a girl looks swell when she meets you, who gives a damn when she’s late? ‘We better hurry’, I said. ‘The show starts at ",

    "quoteSourceTitle": "The Catcher in the Rye",
    "quoteAuthor": "J.D. Salinger",
    "sfw": "yes"
},

"$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-14:40-Compton Mackenzie": {
    "title": "$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-14:40-Compton Mackenzie",
    "time": "14:40",
    "quote_first": "Members of Big Side marked Michael and Alan as the two most promising three-quarters for Middle Side next year, and when the bell sounded at ",
    "quote_time_case": "twenty minutes to three",

    "quoteSourceTitle": "Sinister Street",
    "quoteAuthor": "Compton Mackenzie",
    "sfw": "yes"
},

"$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-14:41-Josephine Tey": {
    "title": "$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-14:41-Josephine Tey",
    "time": "14:41",
    "quote_first": "At ",
    "quote_time_case": "2.41",
    "quote_last": ", when the afternoon fast train to London was pulling out of Larborough prompt to the minute, Miss Pym sat under the cedar on the lawn wondering whether she was a fool, and not caring much anyhow.",
    "quoteSourceTitle": "Miss Pym Disposes",
    "quoteAuthor": "Josephine Tey",
    "sfw": "yes"
},

    "quoteSourceTitle": "Now: Zero",
    "quoteAuthor": "JG Ballard",

"$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-14:45-George and Weedon Grossmith": {

"$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-14:45-Martin Amis": {

"$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-14:45-Daniil Ivanovich Kharms": {
    "title": "$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-14:45-Daniil Ivanovich Kharms",
    "time": "14:45",
    "quote_first": "What time is it?‘ 'Look for yourself,’ the old woman says to me. I look, and I see the clock has no hands. ‘There are no hands,’ I say. The old woman looks at the clock face and says to me, ‘It’s a ",

    "quoteAuthor": "Daniil Ivanovich Kharms",
    "sfw": "yes"
},

    "title": "$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-14:50-Rupert Brooke",
    "time": "14:50",

    "quoteSourceTitle": "The Old Vicarage, Grantchester",

"$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-14:54-Douglas Adams": {
    "title": "$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-14:54-Douglas Adams",
    "time": "14:54",
    "quote_first": "In the end, it was the Sunday afternoons he couldn’t cope with, and that terrible listlessness that starts to set in ",
    "quote_time_case": "about 2.55",
    "quote_last": ", when you know you’ve had all the baths you can usefully have that day, that however hard you stare at any given paragraph in the newspaper you will never actually read it, or use the revolutionary new pruning technique it describes, and that as you stare at the clock the hands will move relentlessly on to four o’clock, and you will enter the long dark teatime of the soul.",
    "quoteSourceTitle": "Life, the universe and everything",
    "quoteAuthor": "Douglas Adams",
    "sfw": "yes"
},

"$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-14:55-James Joyce": {
    "title": "$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-14:55-James Joyce",
    "time": "14:55",
    "quote_first": "The superior, the very reverend John Conmee SJ reset his smooth watch in his interior pocket as he came down the presbytery steps. ",
    "quote_time_case": "Five to three",
    "quote_last": ". Just nice time to walk to Artane.",
    "quoteSourceTitle": "Ulysses",
    "quoteAuthor": "James Joyce",
    "sfw": "yes"
},

"$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-14:56-JG Ballard": {
    "title": "$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-14:56-JG Ballard",
    "time": "14:56",
    "quote_first": "",
    "quote_time_case": "2.56 P.M.",
    "quote_last": " Helen is alone now. Her face is out of frame, and through the viewfinder I see only a segment of the pillow, an area of crumpled sheet and the upper section of her chest and shoulders.",
    "quoteSourceTitle": "The 60 Minute Zoom",
    "quoteAuthor": "JG Ballard",

},

"$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-14:58-Compton Mackenzie": {
    "title": "$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-14:58-Compton Mackenzie",
    "time": "14:58",
    "quote_first": "From twenty minutes past nine until twenty-seven minutes past nine, from twenty-five minutes past eleven until twenty-eight minutes past eleven, from ten minutes to three until ",
    "quote_time_case": "two minutes to three",
    "quote_last": " the heroes of the school met in a large familiarity whose Olympian laughter awed the fearful small boy that flitted uneasily past and chilled the slouching senior that rashly paused to examine the notices in assertion of an unearned right.",
    "quoteSourceTitle": "Sinister Street",
    "quoteAuthor": "Compton Mackenzie",
    "sfw": "yes"
},

"$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-14:58-Mark Twain": {
    "title": "$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-14:58-Mark Twain",
    "time": "14:58",
    "quote_first": "We betted that it would happen on the morrow; they took us up and gave us the odds of two to one; we betted that it would happen in the afternoon; we got odds of four to one on that; we betted that it would happen at ",
    "quote_time_case": "two minutes to three",
    "quote_last": "; they willingly granted us the odds of ten to one on that.",
    "quoteSourceTitle": "The Chronicle of Young Satan",
    "quoteAuthor": "Mark Twain",
    "sfw": "yes"
},

"$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-15:00-John Kennedy Toole": {

"$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-15:00-Arthur Ransome": {

"$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-15:00-Virginia Woolf": {
    "title": "$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-15:00-Virginia Woolf",
    "time": "15:00",
    "quote_first": "And the sound of the bell flooded the room with its melancholy wave; which receded, and gathered itself together to fall once more, when she heard, distractedly, something fumbling, something scratching at the door. Who at this hour? ",
    "quote_time_case": "Three",
    "quote_last": ", good Heavens! Three already!",
    "quoteSourceTitle": "Mrs Dalloway",
    "quoteAuthor": "Virginia Woolf",
    "sfw": "yes"
},

"$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-15:00-Guy de Maupassant": {
    "title": "$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-15:00-Guy de Maupassant",
    "time": "15:00",
    "quote_first": "At ",
    "quote_time_case": "three o'clock",

    "quoteAuthor": "Sir Arthur Conan Doyle",
    "sfw": "yes"

"$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-15:00-Wilkie Collins": {
    "title": "$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-15:00-Wilkie Collins",
    "time": "15:00",
    "quote_first": "",
    "quote_time_case": "At three",
    "quote_last": " on the Wednesday afternoon, that bit of the painting was completed.",
    "quoteSourceTitle": "The Moonstone",
    "quoteAuthor": "Wilkie Collins",
    "sfw": "yes"

"$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-15:00-Alain de Botton": {
    "title": "$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-15:00-Alain de Botton",
    "time": "15:00",
    "quote_first": "Ditched by the woman I loved, I exalted my suffering into a sign of greatness (lying collapsed on a bed ",
    "quote_time_case": "at three",
    "quote_last": " in the afternoon), and hence protected myself from experiencing my grief as the outcome of what was at best a mundane romantic break-up. Chloe’s departure may have killed me, but it had at least left me in glorious possession of the moral high ground. I was a martyr.",
    "quoteSourceTitle": "Essays in Love",
    "quoteAuthor": "Alain de Botton",
    "sfw": "yes"
},

"$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-15:00-Paul Auster": {
    "title": "$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-15:00-Paul Auster",
    "time": "15:00",
    "quote_first": "He walks into the Hospital for Broken Things at ",
    "quote_time_case": "three o'clock",
    "quote_last": " on Monday afternoon. That was the arrangement. If he came in after six o'clock, he was to head straight for the house in Sunset Park.",
    "quoteSourceTitle": "Sunset Park",
    "quoteAuthor": "Paul Auster",
    "sfw": "yes"
},

"$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-15:00-T.C. Boyle": {
    "title": "$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-15:00-T.C. Boyle",
    "time": "15:00",
    "quote_first": "I had a ",
    "quote_time_case": "three o’clock",
    "quote_last": " class in psychology, the first meeting of the semester, and I suspected I was going to miss it. I was right. Victoria made a real ritual of the whole thing, clothes coming off with the masturbatory dalliance of a strip show, the covers rolling back periodically to show this patch of flesh or that, strategically revealed.",
    "quoteSourceTitle": "Achates McNeil",
    "quoteAuthor": "T.C. Boyle",
    "sfw": "yes"
},

"$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-15:00-George Eliot": {
    "title": "$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-15:00-George Eliot",
    "time": "15:00",
    "quote_first": "It was ",
    "quote_time_case": "three o'clock",
    "quote_last": " in the beautiful breezy autumn day when Mr. Casaubon drove off to his Rectory at Lowick, only five miles from Tipton; and Dorothea, who had on her bonnet and shawl, hurried along the shrubbery and across the park that she might wander through the bordering wood with no other visible companionship than that of Monk, the Great St. Bernard dog, who always took care of the young ladies in their walks",
    "quoteSourceTitle": "Middlemarch",
    "quoteAuthor": "George Eliot",
    "sfw": "yes"
},

"$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-15:00-Harper Lee": {
    "title": "$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-15:00-Harper Lee",
    "time": "15:00",
    "quote_first": "Ladies bathed before noon, after their ",
    "quote_time_case": "three-o’clock",
    "quote_last": " naps, and by nightfall were like soft teacakes with frostings of sweat and sweet talcum.",
    "quoteSourceTitle": "To kill a mockingbird",
    "quoteAuthor": "Harper Lee",
    "sfw": "yes"
},

"$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-15:00-Victor Hugo": {
    "title": "$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-15:00-Victor Hugo",
    "time": "15:00",

    "quoteAuthor": "Victor Hugo",
    "sfw": "yes"
},

"$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-15:00-Gustave Flaubert": {

    "quote_last": ", Monsieur and Madame Bovary, seated in their dog-cart, set out for Vaubyessard, with a great trunk strapped on behind and a bonnet-box in front of the apron. Besides these Charles held a bandbox between his knees.",
    "quoteSourceTitle": "Madame Bovary",
    "quoteAuthor": "Gustave Flaubert",
    "sfw": "yes"
},

"$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-15:00-Ian Fleming": {
    "title": "$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-15:00-Ian Fleming",
    "time": "15:00",
    "quote_first": "The scent and smoke and sweat of a casino are nauseating ",
    "quote_time_case": "at three",
    "quote_last": " in the morning. Then the soul-erosion produced by high gambling - a compost of greed and fear and nervous tension - becomes unbearable and the senses awake and revolt from it.",
    "quoteSourceTitle": "Casino Royale",
    "quoteAuthor": "Ian Fleming",
    "sfw": "yes"
},

"$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-15:00-Jean-Paul Sartre": {

    "quoteSourceTitle": "Nausea",
    "quoteAuthor": "Jean-Paul Sartre",
    "sfw": "yes"
},

"$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-15:00-Jonathan Trigell": {
    "title": "$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-15:00-Jonathan Trigell",
    "time": "15:00",
    "quote_first": "",
    "quote_time_case": "Three o'clock",
    "quote_last": " is the perfect time in Cham, because anything is possible. You can still ski, but also respectably start drinking, the shops have just reopened, the sun is still up. Three o'clock is never too late or too early.",
    "quoteSourceTitle": "Cham",
    "quoteAuthor": "Jonathan Trigell",

"$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-15:00-David Lodge": {
    "title": "$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-15:00-David Lodge",
    "time": "15:00",
    "quote_first": "Today was the day Alex had appointed for her ‘punishment’. I became increasingly nervous as the hour of ",
    "quote_time_case": "three o'clock",
    "quote_last": " approached. I was alone in the house, and paced restlessly from room to room, glancing at the clocks in each of them.",
    "quoteSourceTitle": "Deaf Sentence",
    "quoteAuthor": "David Lodge",
    "sfw": "yes"
},

"$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-15:01-Mark Twain": {
    "title": "$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-15:01-Mark Twain",
    "time": "15:01",
    "quote_first": "The sun was now setting. It was ",
    "quote_time_case": "about three",
    "quote_last": " in the afternoon when Alisande had begun to tell me who the cowboys were; so she had made pretty good progress with it - for her. She would arrive some time or other, no doubt, but she was not a person who could be hurried.",
    "quoteSourceTitle": "A Connecticut Yankee in King Arthur's Court",
    "quoteAuthor": "Mark Twain",
    "sfw": "yes"
},

"$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-15:03-Brian Chikwava": {
    "title": "$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-15:03-Brian Chikwava",
    "time": "15:03",

    "quoteSourceTitle": "Harare North",
    "quoteAuthor": "Brian Chikwava",
    "sfw": "yes"
},

"$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-15:04-Hallgr\u00EDmur Helgason": {

    "quoteAuthor": "Hallgrímur Helgason",

"$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-15:05-Truman Capote": {

    "time": "15:05",
    "quote_first": "Ultimately, at ",
    "quote_time_case": "five minutes past three",

    "quoteAuthor": "Truman Capote",
    "sfw": "yes"
},

"$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-15:07-Patrick Hamilton": {
    "title": "$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-15:07-Patrick Hamilton",
    "time": "15:07",
    "quote_first": "The next day was grey, threatening rain. He was there at ",
    "quote_time_case": "seven minutes past three",
    "quote_last": ". The clock on the church over the way pointed to it. They had arranged to be there at three fifteen. Therefore, if she had been there when he came, she would have been eight minutes before her time.",
    "quoteSourceTitle": "Twenty Thousand Streets Under The Sky",
    "quoteAuthor": "Patrick Hamilton",
    "sfw": "yes"
},

"$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-15:08-James Joyce": {
    "title": "$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-15:08-James Joyce",
    "time": "15:08",
    "quote_first": "A private wireless telegraph which would transmit by dot and dash system the result of a national equine handicap (flat or steeplechase) of 1 or more miles and furlongs won by an outsider at odds of 50 to 1 at ",
    "quote_time_case": "3 hr 8 m p.m.",
    "quote_last": " at Ascot (Greenwich time), the message being received and available for betting purposes in Dublin at 2.59 p.m.",
    "quoteSourceTitle": "Ulysses",
    "quoteAuthor": "James Joyce",
    "sfw": "yes"
},

"$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-15:09-Freeman Wills Crofts": {

    "quote_time_case": "3.09",
    "quote_last": ". At Paragon Station he soon singled out Beamish from Merriman’s description.",
    "quoteSourceTitle": "The Pit-Prop Syndicate",

"$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-15:10-M.P. Shiel": {
    "title": "$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-15:10-M.P. Shiel",
    "time": "15:10",

"$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-16:00-Steven Galloway": {
    "title": "$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-16:00-Steven Galloway",
    "time": "16:00",
    "quote_first": "He played for twenty-two days, just as he said he would. Every day at ",
    "quote_time_case": "four o'clock",

    "quoteAuthor": "Steven Galloway",
    "sfw": "yes"
},

"$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-16:00-Susan May Gudge": {
    "title": "$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-16:00-Susan May Gudge",
    "time": "16:00",
    "quote_first": "I only found out much later that those flowers were called ",
    "quote_time_case": "Four O’clock",
    "quote_last": ", and were not magic at all. The magic was in the seed, waiting to be watered and cared for, the real magic was life.",
    "quoteSourceTitle": "Ghost Generations",
    "quoteAuthor": "Susan May Gudge",
    "sfw": "yes"
},

"$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-16:00-Anthony Trollope": {
    "title": "$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-16:00-Anthony Trollope",
    "time": "16:00",
    "quote_first": "I doubt whether anyone was commissioned to send the news along the actual telegraph, and yet Mrs. Proudie knew it before ",
    "quote_time_case": "four o'clock",
    "quote_last": ". But she did not know it quite accurately.‘Bishop’, she said, standing at her husband’s study door. ‘They have committed that man to gaol. There was no help for them unless they had forsworn themselves.'",
    "quoteSourceTitle": "The Last Chronicle of Barset",
    "quoteAuthor": "Anthony Trollope",
    "sfw": "yes"
},

"$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-16:00-Douglas Adams": {
    "title": "$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-16:00-Douglas Adams",
    "time": "16:00",
    "quote_first": "In the end, it was the Sunday afternoons he couldn’t cope with, and that terrible listlessness that starts to set in about 2.55, when you know you’ve had all the baths you can usefully have that day, that however hard you stare at any given paragraph in the newspaper you will never actually read it, or use the revolutionary new pruning technique it describes, and that as you stare at the clock the hands will move relentlessly on to ",
    "quote_time_case": "four o’clock",
    "quote_last": ", and you will enter the long dark teatime of the soul.",
    "quoteSourceTitle": "Life, the universe and everything",
    "quoteAuthor": "Douglas Adams",
    "sfw": "yes"
},

"$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-16:00-Aldous Huxley": {
    "title": "$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-16:00-Aldous Huxley",
    "time": "16:00",
    "quote_first": "In the four thousand rooms of the Centre the four thousand electric clocks simultaneously ",
    "quote_time_case": "struck four",
    "quote_last": ". Discarnate voices called from the trumpet mouths. “Main Day-shift off duty. Second Day-shift take over. Main Day-shift off …"",
    "quoteSourceTitle": "Brave New World",
    "quoteAuthor": "Aldous Huxley",
    "sfw": "yes"
},

"$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-16:00-David Lodge": {
    "title": "$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-16:00-David Lodge",
    "time": "16:00",
    "quote_first": "It was my turn to cook the evening meal so I didn’t linger in the common room. It was exactly ",
    "quote_time_case": "4 o'clock",
    "quote_last": " as I made my way out of the building, and doors opened behind and before me, discharging salvos of vocal babble and the noise of chair-legs scraping on wooden floors.",
    "quoteSourceTitle": "Deaf Sentence",
    "quoteAuthor": "David Lodge",
    "sfw": "yes"
},

"$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-16:00-James Joyce": {
    "title": "$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-16:00-James Joyce",
    "time": "16:00",
    "quote_first": "Miss Douce took Boylan’s coin, struck boldly the cashregister. It clanged. Clock clacked. Fair one of Egypt teased and sorted in the till and hummed and handed coins in change. Look to the west. A clack. For me. —What time is that? asked Blazes Boylan. ",
    "quote_time_case": "Four",
    "quote_last": "? O'clock. Lenehan, small eyes ahunger on her humming, bust ahumming, tugged Blazes Boylan’s elbowsleeve. —Let’s hear the time, he said.",
    "quoteSourceTitle": "Ulysses",
    "quoteAuthor": "James Joyce",
    "sfw": "yes"
},

"$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-16:00-David Foster Wallace": {
    "title": "$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-16:00-David Foster Wallace",
    "time": "16:00",
    "quote_first": "The horrifying R.N. wipes Gately’s face off as best she can with her hand and says she’ll try to fit him in for a sponge bath before she goes off shift at ",
    "quote_time_case": "1600h.",
    "quote_last": ", at which Gately goes rigid with dread.",
    "quoteSourceTitle": "Infinite Jest",
    "quoteAuthor": "David Foster Wallace",
    "sfw": "yes"
},

"$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-16:01-Hallgr\u00EDmur Helgason": {
    "title": "$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-16:01-Hallgrímur Helgason",
    "time": "16:01",
    "quote_first": "Light is coming in through the curtains. Suddenly the digits on the clock radio look like a year. ",
    "quote_time_case": "1601",
    "quote_last": ". I woke up a bit early, don’t have to be born for another 400 years.",
    "quoteSourceTitle": "101 Reykjavik",
    "quoteAuthor": "Hallgrímur Helgason",
    "sfw": "yes"
},

"$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-16:02-Carolyn G Hart": {
    "title": "$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-16:02-Carolyn G Hart",
    "time": "16:02",
    "quote_first": "I’d just looked up at the clock, to make sure time wasn’t getting away from me, when I heard the shot. It was ",
    "quote_time_case": "two minutes after four",
    "quote_last": ". I didn’t know what to do.",
    "quoteSourceTitle": "Southern Ghost",
    "quoteAuthor": "Carolyn G Hart",
    "sfw": "yes"
},

    "title": "$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-16:03-Catherine O'Flynn",

    "quote_time_case": "A little after four o'clock",

"$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-16:05-Sylvia Plath": {
    "title": "$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-16:05-Sylvia Plath",
    "time": "16:05",
    "quote_first": "I was standing at the top of the long flight, overlooking the red brick buildings that walled the snow-filled quad and preparing to catch the trolley back to the asylum, when a tall young man with a rather ugly and bespectacled, but intelligent face, came up and said, ‘Could you please tell me the time?’ I glanced at my watch. ‘",
    "quote_time_case": "Five past four",
    "quote_last": ".'",
    "quoteSourceTitle": "The Bell Jar",
    "quoteAuthor": "Sylvia Plath",
    "sfw": "yes"
},

"$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-16:05-Mary Elizabeth Braddon": {
    "title": "$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-16:05-Mary Elizabeth Braddon",
    "time": "16:05",
    "quote_first": "IT was exactly ",
    "quote_time_case": "five minutes past four",
    "quote_last": " as Mr. Robert Audley stepped out upon the platform at Shoreditch, and waited placidly … it took a long while to make matters agreeable to all claimants, and even the barrister’s seraphic indifference to mundane affairs nearly gave way.",
    "quoteSourceTitle": "Lady Audley's Secret",

    "sfw": "yes"
},

    "time": "16:06",
    "quote_first": "At ",

"$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-16:07-Gabriel Garc\u00EDa M\u00E1rquez": {

    "time": "16:07",
    "quote_first": "But he released him immediately because the ladder slipped from under his feet and for an instant he was suspended in air and then he realised that he had died without Communion, without time to repent of anything or to say goodbye to anyone, at ",
    "quote_time_case": "seven minutes after four",
    "quote_last": " on Pentecost Sunday.",
    "quoteSourceTitle": "Love in the Time of Cholera",
    "quoteAuthor": "Gabriel García Márquez",
    "sfw": "yes"
},

    "time": "16:10",
    "quote_first": "She looks at the clock. She’s in the kitchen. A minute left. She waits. It’s ",

She bites into the chocolate, and the pastry that’s been softened by the cream. Jack’s not home yet. Leannes’s at work. Paula will be leaving, herself, in a bit. She’s a year off the drink. Exactly a year. She looks at the clock. A year and a minute.",

    "quote_first": "But at precisely ",

    "quote_time_case": "4.14pm",
    "quote_last": " on March 12 I moved behind zinc-zirconium-not-to-be-revealed-compounds protecting me in this hill, and God have mercy but the struggle is just exchanged for the next one, which is exhausting me further as I say, to separate the true from the false.",

"$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-16:15-Jane Austen": {

"$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-16:15-JG Ballard": {
    "title": "$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-16:15-JG Ballard",
    "time": "16:15",
    "quote_first": "Must have the phone disconnected. Some contractor keeps calling me up about payment for 50 bags of cement he claims I collected ten days ago. Says he helped me load them onto a truck himself. I did drive Whitby’s pick-up into town but only to get some lead screening. What does he think I’d do with all that cement? Just the sort of irritating thing you don’t expect to hang over your final exit. (Moral: don’t try too hard to forget Eniwetok.) Woke 9:40. To sleep ",
    "quote_time_case": "4:15",
    "quote_last": ".",
    "quoteSourceTitle": "The Voices of Time",
    "quoteAuthor": "JG Ballard",
    "sfw": "yes"
},

"$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-16:15-Joan Didion": {
    "title": "$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-16:15-Joan Didion",
    "time": "16:15",
    "quote_first": "On the tenth day of October at ",
    "quote_time_case": "quarter past four",
    "quote_last": " in the afternoon with a dry hot wind blowing through the passes Maria found herself in Baker. She had never meant to go as far as Baker, had started out that day as every day, her only destination the freeway. But she had driven out the San Bernardino and up the Barstow and instead of turning back at Barstow (she had been out that far before but never that late in the day, it was past time to navigate back, she was Out too far too late, the rhythm was lost) she kept driving.",
    "quoteSourceTitle": "Play it as it Lays",
    "quoteAuthor": "Joan Didion",
    "sfw": "yes"
},

"$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-16:15-Haruki Murakami": {
    "title": "$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-16:15-Haruki Murakami",
    "time": "16:15",

    "quoteSourceTitle": "The Wind-up Bird Chronicle",
    "quoteAuthor": "Haruki Murakami",
    "sfw": "yes"
},

},

"$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-16:17-P.G. Wodehouse": {

"$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-16:17-Joy Fielding": {

"$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-16:21-Richard Matheson": {

    "quote_first": "As I dressed I glanced at my watch. It was no wonder that no one was stirring. It was ",

    "quote_first": "Thinking about the card warms me to the idea of walking under the arched doorway of the Newtons' home, but when I arrive at their house, the plan seems ridiculous. What am I doing? It’s ",

"$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-17:00-William Maxwell": {

"$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-17:00-Scarlett Thomas": {

"$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-17:00-Charlotte Bront\u00EB": {

    "quote_first": "ERE THE HALF-HOUR ended, ",
    "quote_time_case": "five o'clock",

    "quoteSourceTitle": "Jane Eyre",
    "quoteAuthor": "Charlotte Brontë",
    "sfw": "yes"
},

"$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-17:00-Henry James": {

    "time": "17:00",
    "quote_first": "She had not seen her yet, as Osmond had given her to understand that it was too soon to begin. She drove at ",

"$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-17:00-Daphne du Maurier": {

    "time": "17:00",
    "quote_first": "We motored, I remember, leaving London in the morning in a heavy shower of rain, coming to Manderley about ",
    "quote_time_case": "five o'clock",
    "quote_last": ", in time for tea. I can see myself now, unsuitably dressed as usual, although a bride of seven weeks, in a tan-coloured stockinette frock, a small fur known as a stone marten round my neck, and over all a shapeless mackintosh, far too big for me and dragging to my ankles.",

    "time": "17:25",
    "quote_first": "It was ",
    "quote_time_case": "five-twenty-five",
    "quote_last": " when I pulled up in front of the library. Still early for our date, so I got out of the car and took a stroll down the misty streets. In a coffee shop, watched a golf match on television, then I went to an entertainment center and played a video game. The object of the game was to wipe out tanks invading from across the river. I was winning at first, but as the game went on, the enemy tanks bred like lemmings, crushing me by sheer number and destroying my base. An on-screen nuclear blast took care of everything, followed by the message game over insert coin.",
    "quoteSourceTitle": "Hard Boiled Wonderland and the End of the World",
    "quoteAuthor": "Haruki Murakami",
    "sfw": "yes"
},

    "quote_first": "He went up to his coachman, who was dozing on the box in the shadow, already lengthening, of a thick lime-tree; he admired the shifting clouds of midges circling over the hot horses, and, waking the coachman, he jumped into the carriage, and told him to drive to Bryansky’s. It was only after driving nearly five miles that he had sufficiently recovered himself to look at his watch, and realise that it was ",
    "quote_time_case": "half-past five",

    "quoteAuthor": "Leo Tolstoy",
    "sfw": "yes"
},

"$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-17:40-Zhu Wen": {

    "time": "17:40",

"$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-17:40-Sophie Kinsella": {
    "title": "$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-17:40-Sophie Kinsella",
    "time": "17:40",
    "quote_first": "It’s ",
    "quote_time_case": "five-forty",
    "quote_last": " now. The party’s at six. By about ten past, the eleventh floor should be clearing. Arnold is a very popular partner; no one’s going to miss his farewell speech if they can help it. Plus, at Carter Spink parties, the speeches always happen early on, so people can get back to work if they need to. And while everyone’s listening I’ll slip down to Arnold’s office. It should work. It has to work. As I stare at my own bizarre reflection, I feel a grim resolve hardening inside me. He’s not going to get away with everyone thinking he’s a cheery, harmless old teddy bear. He’s not going to get away with it.",
    "quoteSourceTitle": "The Undomestic Goddess",
    "quoteAuthor": "Sophie Kinsella",
    "sfw": "yes"
},

"$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-17:46-P.G. Wodehouse": {

    "time": "17:46",
    "quote_first": "Through the curtained windows of the furnished apartment which Mrs. Horace Hignett had rented for her stay in New York rays of golden sunlight peeped in like the foremost spies of some advancing army. It was a fine summer morning. The hands of the Dutch clock in the hall pointed to thirteen minutes past nine; those of the ormolu clock in the sitting-room to eleven minutes past ten; those of the carriage clock on the bookshelf to ",
    "quote_time_case": "fourteen minutes to six",
    "quote_last": ". In other words, it was exactly eight; and Mrs. Hignett acknowledged the fact by moving her head on the pillow, opening her eyes, and sitting up in bed. She always woke at eight precisely.",
    "quoteSourceTitle": "Three Men and a Maid",

    "quote_first": "Folded in this triple melody, the audience sat gazing; and beheld gently and approvingly without interrogation, for it seemed inevitable, a box tree in a green tub take the place of the ladies’ dressing-room; while on what seemed to be a wall, was hung a great clock face; the hands pointing to ",

    "quote_first": "The party was to begin at seven. The invitations gave the hour as six-thirty because the family knew everyone would come a little late, so as not to be the first to arrive. At ",

    "time": "19:11",
    "quote_first": "Good, you said. Run, or you won’t get a seat. See you soon. Your voice was reassuring. ",
    "quote_time_case": "19:11",
    "quote_last": ":00, the clock said. I put the phone back on its hook and I ran. The seat I got, almost the last one in the carriage, was opposite a girl who started coughing as soon as there weren’t any other free seats I could move to. She looked pale and the cough rattled deep in her chest as she punched numbers into her mobile. Hi, she said (cough). I’m on the train. No, I’ve got a cold. A cold (cough). Yeah, really bad. Yeah, awful actually. Hello? (cough) Hello?",

    "sfw": "yes"

    "time": "19:49",
    "quote_first": "There’s a big, old-fashioned clock in the surgery. Just as Dr. Wellesley went out I heard the Moot Hall clock chime half-past seven, and then the chimes of St. Hathelswide’s Church. I noticed that our clock was a couple of minutes slow, and I put it right.“ When did you next see Dr. Wellesley?” “At just ",
    "quote_time_case": "eleven minutes to eight",
    "quote_last": ".” “Where?” “In the surgery.” “He came back there?” “Yes.” “How do you fix that precise time–eleven minutes to eight?” “Because he’d arranged to see a patient in Meadow Gate at ten minutes to eight.     "sfw": "yes"

    "quote_first": "“Wait,” he said solemnly, “till the clock strikes. I have wealth and power and knowledge above most men, but when the clock strikes I am afraid. Stay by me until then. But there must be no clocks in that palace–they measure our follies and limit our pleasures. Do you agree to that?” “Of course,” said the young man, cheerfully, “they’re a nuisance, anyway–always ticking and striking and getting you late for dinner.” He glanced again at the clock in the tower.     "time": "22:10",
    "quote_first": "That was the past, and now I had just died on the narrow couch of a Paris lodging house, and my wife was crouching on the floor, crying bitterly. The white light before my left eye was growing dim, but I remembered the room perfectly. On the left there was a chest of drawers, on the right a mantelpiece surmounted by a damaged clock without a pendulum, the hands of which marked ",
    "quote_time_case": "ten minutes past ten",
    "quote_last": ". The window overlooked the Rue Dauphine, a long, dark street. All Paris seemed to pass below, and the noise was so great that the window shook.",

    "quoteAuthor": "Emile Zola",
    "sfw": "yes"
},

So I went back inside.",

"$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-23:03-Christopher Buckley": {
    "title": "$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-23:03-Christopher Buckley",
    "time": "23:03",
    "quote_first": "“What makes you think it’s for real?” “Just a hunch, really. He sounded for real. Sometimes you can just tell about people”-he smiled-“even if you’re a dull old WASP.” “I think it’s a setup.” “Why?” “I just do. Why would someone from the government want to help you?” “Good question. Guess I’ll find out.” She went back into the kitchen.“What time are you meeting him?” she called out. “",
    "quote_time_case": "Eleven oh-three",
    "quote_last": ",” he said. “That made me think he’s for real. Military and intelligence types set precise appointment times to eliminate confusion and ambiguity. Nothing ambiguous about eleven oh-three."",
    "quoteSourceTitle": "Little Green Men",
    "quoteAuthor": "Christopher Buckley",
    "sfw": "yes"
},

"$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-23:05-L.P.Hartley": {
    "title": "$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-23:05-L.P.Hartley",
    "time": "23:05",
    "quote_first": "It was ",
    "quote_time_case": "11.05",
    "quote_last": ", five minutes later than my habitual bedtime. I felt. I felt guilty at being still up, but the past kept pricking at me and I knew that all the events of those nineteen days in July were astir within me, like the loosening phlegm in an attack of bronchitis",
    "quoteSourceTitle": "The Go-Between",
    "quoteAuthor": "L.P.Hartley",
    "sfw": "yes"
},

"$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-23:05-Sir Arthur Conan Doyle": {
    "title": "$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-23:05-Sir Arthur Conan Doyle",
    "time": "23:05",
    "quote_first": "It was ",
    "quote_time_case": "five minutes past eleven",
    "quote_last": " when I made my last entry. I remember winding up my watch and noting the time. So I have wasted some five hours of the little span still left to us. Who would have believed it possible? But I feel very much fresher, and ready for my fate–or try to persuade myself that I am. And yet, the fitter a man is, and the higher his tide of life, the more must he shrink from death. How wise and how merciful is that provision of nature by which his earthly anchor is usually loosened by many little imperceptible tugs, until his consciousness has drifted out of its untenable earthly harbor into the great sea beyond!",
    "quoteSourceTitle": "The Poison Belt",
    "quoteAuthor": "Sir Arthur Conan Doyle",
    "sfw": "yes"
},

"$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-23:05-Stanley Donwood": {

    "time": "23:10",

    "quote_time_case": "ten past eleven",

"$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-23:11-Joan Didion": {
    "title": "$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-23:11-Joan Didion",
    "time": "23:11",
    "quote_first": "Life changes fast Life changes in an instant You sit down to dinner and life as you know it ends. The Question of self-pity. Those were the first words I wrote after it happened. The computer dating on the Microsoft Word file (“Notes on change.doc”) reads “May 20, 2004, ",
    "quote_time_case": "11:11 p.m.",
    "quote_last": ",” but that would have been a case of my opening the file and reflexively pressing save when I closed it. I had made no changes to that file since I wrote the words, in January 2004, a day or two after the fact. For a long time I wrote nothing else. Life changes in the instant. The ordinary instant.",
    "quoteSourceTitle": "The Year of Magical Thinking",
    "quoteAuthor": "Joan Didion",
    "sfw": "yes"
},

    "time": "23:32",
    "quote_first": "“This is the evening. This is the night. It is New Year´s Eve. ",
    "quote_time_case": "In about twenty-eight minutes it will be midnight.",
    "quote_last": " I still have twenty-eight minutes left. I have to recollect my thoughts. At twelve o´clock, I should be done thinking.” He looked at his father. “Help those that are depressed and consider themselves lost in this world,” he thought. “Old fart."",
    "quoteSourceTitle": "The Evenings",
    "quoteAuthor": "Gerard Reve",
    "sfw": "yes"
},

"$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-23:32-Mark Haddon": {

    "time": "23:32",
    "quote_first": "And then it started to rain and I got wet and I started shivering because I was cold. And then it was ",
    "quote_time_case": "11.32 pm",
    "quote_last": " and I heard voices of people walking along the street. And a voice said, ‘I don’t care whether you thought it was funny or not,’ and it was a lady’s voice.",

    "quoteAuthor": "Mark Haddon",
    "sfw": "yes"
},

    "time": "23:33",
    "quote_first": "We are on Colaba Causeway now, just for a moment, to reveal that at ",
    "quote_time_case": "twenty-seven minutes to midnight",
    "quote_last": ", the police are hunting for a dangerous criminal. His name: Joseph D'Costa. The orderly is absent, has been absent for several days, from his work at the Nursing Home, from his room near the slaughterhouse, and from the life of a distraught virginal Mary",
    "quoteSourceTitle": "Midnight's Children",
    "quoteAuthor": "Salman Rushdie",
    "sfw": "yes"

"$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-23:34-Bret Easton Ellis": {
    "title": "$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-23:34-Bret Easton Ellis",
    "time": "23:34",
    "quote_first": "",
    "quote_time_case": "Eleven thirty-four",
    "quote_last": ". We stand on the sidewalk in front of Jean’s apartment on the Upper East Side. Her doorman eyes us warily and fills me with a nameless dread, his gaze piercing me from the lobby. A curtain of stars, miles of them, are scattered, glowing, across the sky and their multitude humbles me, which I have a hard time tolerating. She shrugs and nods after I say something about forms of anxiety. It’s as if her mind is having a hard time communicating with her mouth, as if she is searching for a rational analysis of who I am, which is, of course, an impossibility: there … is … no … key.",
    "quoteSourceTitle": "American Psycho",
    "quoteAuthor": "Bret Easton Ellis",
    "sfw": "yes"
},
