    "quote_first": "The church clocks chimed ",
    "quote_time_case": "three quarters past eleven",
    "quote_last": ", as two figures emerged on London Bridge. One, which advanced with a swift and rapid step, was that of a woman who looked eagerly about her as though in quest of some expected object; the other figure was that of a man…",
    "quoteSourceTitle": "Oliver Twist",
    "quoteAuthor": "Charles Dickens",
    "sfw": "yes"
},

"$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-23:45-Jerome K. Jerome": {
    "title": "$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-23:45-Jerome K. Jerome",
    "time": "23:45",
    "quote_first": "We struck the tow-path at length, and that made us happy because prior to this we had not been sure whether we were walking towards the river or away from it, and when you are tired and want to go to bed, uncertainties like that worry you. We passed Shiplake as the clock was striking the ",
    "quote_time_case": "quarter to twelve",
    "quote_last": " and then George said thoughtfully: ‘You don’t happen to remember which of the islands it was, do you?’",
    "quoteSourceTitle": "Three Men in a Boat",
    "quoteAuthor": "Jerome K. Jerome",
    "sfw": "yes"
},

"$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-23:46-Joyce Carol Oates": {
    "title": "$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-23:46-Joyce Carol Oates",
    "time": "23:46",
    "quote_first": "In the Kismet Lounge, Mr. Early sees suddenly to his horror it’s ",
    "quote_time_case": "11:46 p.m.",
    "quote_last": " He’s been in this place far longer than he’d planned, and he’s had more to drink than he’d planned. Shame! What if, back at the E-Z, his little girl is crying piteously for him?",
    "quoteSourceTitle": "Doll: A Romance of the Mississippi",
    "quoteAuthor": "Joyce Carol Oates",
    "sfw": "yes"
},

"$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-23:47-Rudolf Ja\u0161\u00EDk": {
    "title": "$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-23:47-Rudolf Jašík",
    "time": "23:47",
    "quote_first": "If he had glanced at his watch, he would have seen that it was ",
    "quote_time_case": "thirteen minutes to midnight",
    "quote_last": ". And if he had been interested in what was going on, he would have heard the voices and bawling of terrified men.",
    "quoteSourceTitle": "Dead Soldiers Don't Sing",
    "quoteAuthor": "Rudolf Jašík",
    "sfw": "yes"
},

"$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-23:48-James Ellroy": {
    "title": "$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-23:48-James Ellroy",
    "time": "23:48",
    "quote_first": "Littell arranged a private charter.He told the pilot to fly balls-to-the-wall.The little two-seater rattled and shook-Kemper couldn’t believe it. It was ",
    "quote_time_case": "11.48pm.",
    "quote_last": " They were thirty-six hours short of GO.",
    "quoteSourceTitle": "American Tabloid",
    "quoteAuthor": "James Ellroy",
    "sfw": "yes"
},

"$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-23:49-The Patricia Highsmith": {
    "title": "$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-23:49-The Patricia Highsmith",
    "time": "23:49",
    "quote_first": "Tom shrugged. He pushed his pinkish ruffled sleeve back, and saw that it was ",
    "quote_time_case": "eleven minutes to midnight",
    "quote_last": ". Tom finished his coffee.",
    "quoteSourceTitle": "The Boy Who Followed Ripley",
    "quoteAuthor": "The Patricia Highsmith",
    "sfw": "yes"
},

"$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-23:50-Jonathan Safran Foer": {
    "title": "$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-23:50-Jonathan Safran Foer",
    "time": "23:50",
    "quote_first": "At ",
    "quote_time_case": "11.50pm",
    "quote_last": ", I got up extremely quietly, took my things from under the bed, and opened the door one millimeter at a time, so it wouldn’t make any noise.",
    "quoteSourceTitle": "Extremely Loud and Incredibly Close",
    "quoteAuthor": "Jonathan Safran Foer",
    "sfw": "yes"
},

"$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-23:51-Sax Rohmer": {
    "title": "$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-23:51-Sax Rohmer",
    "time": "23:51",
    "quote_first": "“Due at Waterloo at ",
    "quote_time_case": "eleven-fifty-one",
    "quote_last": ",” panted Smith.“That gives us thirty-nine minutes to get to the other side of the river and reach his hotel."",
    "quoteSourceTitle": "The Mystery of Dr Fu Manchu",
    "quoteAuthor": "Sax Rohmer",
    "sfw": "yes"
},

"$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-23:52-Kingsley Amis": {
    "title": "$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-23:52-Kingsley Amis",
    "time": "23:52",
    "quote_first": "It was ",
    "quote_time_case": "eight minutes to midnight",
    "quote_last": ". Just nice time, I said to myself. Indoors, everything was quiet and in darkness. Splendid. I went to the bar and fetched a tumbler, a siphon of soda and a bottle of Glen Grant, took a weak drink and a pill, and settled down in the public dining-room to wait the remaining two minutes.",
    "quoteSourceTitle": "The Green Man",
    "quoteAuthor": "Kingsley Amis",
    "sfw": "yes"
},

"$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-23:53-Mark Haddon": {
    "title": "$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-23:53-Mark Haddon",
    "time": "23:53",
    "quote_first": "It was ",
    "quote_time_case": "7 minutes to midnight",
    "quote_last": ". The dog was lying on the grass in the middle of the lawn in front of Mrs. Shears' house.",
    "quoteSourceTitle": "The Curious Incident of the Dog in the Night-time",
    "quoteAuthor": "Mark Haddon",
    "sfw": "yes"
},

"$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-23:54-Greg Tobin": {
    "title": "$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-23:54-Greg Tobin",
    "time": "23:54",
    "quote_first": "His watch read ",
    "quote_time_case": "11.54pm",
    "quote_last": " Eastern Standard Time. Already it was nearly 6.00am in Rome. He had left a city frozen by a harsh January storm, after a bleak, wet Christmas season.",
    "quoteSourceTitle": "Conclave",
    "quoteAuthor": "Greg Tobin",
    "sfw": "yes"
},

"$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-23:55-J. K. Rowling": {
    "title": "$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-23:55-J. K. Rowling",
    "time": "23:55",
    "quote_first": "“I am going to lock you in. It is-” he consulted his watch, “",
    "quote_time_case": "five minutes to midnight",
    "quote_last": ". Miss Granger, three turns should do it. Good luck."",
    "quoteSourceTitle": "Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban",
    "quoteAuthor": "J. K. Rowling",
    "sfw": "yes"
},

"$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-23:55-Wilkie Collins": {
    "title": "$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-23:55-Wilkie Collins",
    "time": "23:55",
    "quote_first": "I looked at my watch. It wanted ",
    "quote_time_case": "five minutes to twelve",
    "quote_last": ", when the premonitory symptoms of the working of the laudanum first showed themselves to me. At this time, no unpractised eyes would have detected any change in him. But, as the minutes of the new morning wore away, the swiftly-subtle progress of the influence began to show itself more plainly. The sublime intoxication of opium gleamed in his eyes; the dew of a stealthy perspiration began to glisten on his face. In five minutes more, the talk which he still kept up with me, failed in coherence.",
    "quoteSourceTitle": "The Moonstone",
    "quoteAuthor": "Wilkie Collins",
    "sfw": "yes"
},

"$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-23:56-Fay Weldon": {
    "title": "$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-23:56-Fay Weldon",
    "time": "23:56",
    "quote_first": "The human race is at the end of the line, the doomsday clock ticks on. It’s stopped for a decade at ",
    "quote_time_case": "four minutes to midnight",
    "quote_last": ", but there the hands still stand. Any minute now they’ll begin to move again.",
    "quoteSourceTitle": "Wicked Women",
    "quoteAuthor": "Fay Weldon",
    "sfw": "yes"
},

"$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-23:57-Cormac McCarthy": {
    "title": "$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-23:57-Cormac McCarthy",
    "time": "23:57",
    "quote_first": "Wells looked out at the street. “What time is it?” he said. Chigurh raised his wrist and looked at his watch. “",
    "quote_time_case": "Eleven fifty-seven",
    "quote_last": "” he said. Wells nodded. By the old woman’s calendar I’ve got three more minutes.",
    "quoteSourceTitle": "No Country for Old Men",
    "quoteAuthor": "Cormac McCarthy",
    "sfw": "yes"
},

"$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-23:58-Bill Bryson": {
    "title": "$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-23:58-Bill Bryson",
    "time": "23:58",
    "quote_first": "Humans emerge ",
    "quote_time_case": "one minute and seventeen seconds before midnight",
    "quote_last": ". The whole of our recorded history, on this scale, would be no more than a few seconds, a single human lifetime barely an instant.",
    "quoteSourceTitle": "A Short History of Nearly Everything",
    "quoteAuthor": "Bill Bryson",
    "sfw": "yes"
},

"$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-23:59-Marcel Aym\u00E9": {
    "title": "$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-23:59-Marcel Aymé",
    "time": "23:59",
    "quote_first": "At ",
    "quote_time_case": "a minute to midnight",
    "quote_last": ", Roquenton was holding his wife’s hand and giving her some last words of advice. On the stroke of midnight, she felt her companion’s hand melt away inside her own.",
    "quoteSourceTitle": "The Man Who Walked Through Walls",
    "quoteAuthor": "Marcel Aymé",
    "sfw": "yes"
},

"$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-23:59-Cormac McCarthy": {
    "title": "$:/plugins/TrueTrueFalse/litClock/times/-23:59-Cormac McCarthy",
    "time": "23:59",
    "quote_first": "Chigurgh rose and picked up the empty casing off the rug and blew into it and put it in his pocket and looked at his watch. The ",
    "quote_time_case": "new day was still a minute away",
    "quote_last": ".",
    "quoteSourceTitle": "No Country for Old Men",
    "quoteAuthor": "Cormac McCarthy",
    "sfw": "yes"
}}
}
